loans.use: Buying additional inventory for her store

loans.name: Edoh

texts.fr: Dame  Edoh   est  couturière  de  profession.  Elle a 30 ans  et  est  née  à  Baguida.  Elle  a  2 enfants à charge.   Elle  a  commencé  en  1996  et  s’approvisionne  au  grand  marché  de  Lomé.  Elle   a son  atelier  en  face  du chef  du  quartier. Elle  demande  un  prêt  pour  acheter  une  machine  à coudre.
texts.en: Madam Edoh is a professional dressmaker.  She is 30 years old and was born in Baguida.  She supports two children.  She began in 1996 and re-stocks at the Grand Market of Lomé.  Her workshop is located in front of the neighborhood chief.  She is asking for a loan to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.use: Purchasing a sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy school supplies, groceries , chairs and tables for her store.

loans.name: Lenny William

texts.es:
Lenny de 20 años reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, Vive con sus padres, es soltero y se dedica al comercio de ganado y cultivo agrícola, él aprendió este oficio por su padre, pues desde pequeño lo ha acompañado en su trabajo y hasta el momento ha aprendido todo perfectamente.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono, fertilizantes para sembrar maíz también comprara ganado de ajustarle el dinero, con este préstamo espera contribuir al incremento del negocio, y a generar ingresos para ayudar a sus padres y ahorrar para sus propios gastos.
La aspiración de Lenny con el negocio es,  que con préstamos pueda ampliarse en ganadería, tener buenos cultivos para aportar a su familia un mayor porcentaje económico.
texts.en:
Lenny, 20 years old, lives in El Transito in the department of San Miguel.  He lives with his parents, is single, and works selling cattle and cultivating crops.  He learned the trade from his father; since he was young he has accompanied him in his work and has learned everything he needs to know from him.  

Currently he is asking for a loan to buy manure and fertilizers to plant corn, and also to buy cattle if there is money left.  With this loan he hopes to contribute to the growth of his business and to generate income to help his parents and to save for his own expenses.  

Lenny's dream for this business is that with these loans he will be able to grow his herd of cattle and have good crops to increase his economic support of his family.

loans.use: To buy manure, fertilizers and cattle.

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Florida is 46 years old. She has two children who are 22 and 18 years old. Florida is a widow. 

Florida sells foodstuffs, such as beans, and she has done this business for 10 years. Florida requests a loan to purchase more foodstuffs to make additional profits, and to renovate her house with the profits she plans to make.

loans.use: Buying additional inventory of beans

loans.name: Joanyta

texts.fr: Dame  Joanyta   est  âgée  de  34 ans.  Elle  est  mariée  avec  3  enfants à charge.  Elle  est revendeuse   de  produits  d’alimentation  et  les  boissons  BB.  Elle  a  commencé  en  1995  et  s’approvisionne  au grand  marché  de  Lomé et à la Brasserie du Benin.  Elle a employé une personne dans  la boutique.  Elle  sollicite  un  prêt  pour   acheter  2  cartons  de boîte  de tomate,  2 cartons de     spaghetti  et  20  casiers  de produits  BB.
texts.en: Madam Joanyta is 34 years old.  She is married and supports three children.  She is a reseller of foodstuffs and BB beverages.  She began in 1995 and re-stocks at the Grand Market of Lomé and at the Brasserie of Benin.  She has employed one person in her shop.  She is requesting a loan in order to purchase two boxes of canned tomatoes, two boxes of pasta and 20 cases of BB products.

loans.use: Purchasing tomatoes, pasta and BB beverages

loans.name: Luz Ángela

texts.es:
La adecuación de una de las habitaciones para hacer su propio negocio fue el primer paso para que Luz Ángela M., motivada por la difícil situación económica por la que atravesaban ella y su esposo, encontrara en la confección una oportunidad para aportar para cubrir los gastos familiares. 

Luz Ángela aprendió el oficio de la confección empíricamente desde el 2003 cuando pasaba por esa difícil situación económica, negocio que actualmente perdura y que se ha convertido en una fuente importante del sustento familiar. 

Actualmente, Luz Ángela necesita de un préstamo para la compra de insumos y telas, debido a que tiene pedidos pendientes.
texts.en:
The first step Luz Ángela M. took to start her own business was to take was to modify one of the rooms in her home. Motivated by a difficult economic situation for her husband and herself, she found dressmaking to be an opportunity for her to help with her family’s household expenses. 

In 2003, Luz Ángela started to learn dressmaking by practicing while she was experiencing a tough economic time. This business continues today and it has become an important source of income for her family.

Luz Ángela needs this loan to purchase supplies and fabrics since she has unfinished orders.

loans.use: to purchase supplies

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette, 62 years old, has four children between the ages of 19 and 21, two of whom attend school, while the other two completed their primary school and then stopped their studies due to insufficient funds to pay for school fees.

Bernadette sells sorghum and is requesting a loan to buy more sorghum. With the additional profits she plans to buy a domestic animal to rear.

loans.use: To buy additional sorghum to sell

loans.name: Apeafa  Amevi

texts.fr: Mariée  et  mère  d’un enfant, Dame   Apeafa  a 35 ans.  Elle  est née  à  Lomé.  Pour contribuer   au  ménage, elle  fait  la  vente  des  verres  et chaussures  pour   enfant.  Elle  a  commencé  en  2009 et s’approvisionne  au  port  autonome  de  Lomé  et au grand  marché  de  Lomé.  Elle  a  remboursé  déjà  2  crédits  à  Wages.  Elle   demande  un prêt  pour  satisfaire  plus  de  clients.
texts.en: Married and the mother of one, Apeafa is 35 years old. She was born in Lome. In order to contribute to the household, she sells drinking glasses and kids' shoes. She started out in 2009 and she makes her purchases at the autonomous port in Lome and in the large market in Lome. She has already repaid 2 past loans with Wages (Kiva Field Partner). She requests a loan in order to satisfy more clients.

loans.use: To purchase drinking cups and kids' shoes.

loans.name: Komlan  Apeleté

texts.fr: Monsieur  Komlan a 26  ans. Il  habite  quartier  Avepozo.   Il fait la  vente de friperie.  Il  a débuté en 2007 cette activité et  s’approvisionne  au marché  de hédzranawoé.  Ensuite il  les  revend  au  marché d’avépozo.   IL  demande   un  prêt  pour  acheter  4   balles  de Jeans  et  2  balles   de  chemise.
texts.en: Komlan is 26 years old. He lives in Avepozo. He sells used clothing. He started out in 2007 with this business and he makes his purchases in Hedzranawoe. He later resells in the Avepozo market. He requests a loan to purchase 4 loads of jeans and 2 loads of shirts.

loans.use: To purchase used clothing.

loans.name: Gladys Susana

texts.es:
Gladys  es una madre de familia de 39 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en su casa propia ubicada en el  distrito agrícola de Tumán, una zona conocida por el sembrío de caña de azúcar que se encuentra situada a más de hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Gladys trabaja por las mañanas vendiendo golosinas en el interior del mercado de Tumán, por las noches afuera de su domicilio ella se dedica a la preparación y venta de hamburguesas y salchipollo desde hace algunos años, ella prepara sus alimentos en su domicilio para luego ofrecerlos en venta al público en general. El negocio goza de muy buena acogida por parte de sus clientes debido a la buena sazón con la que prepara sus productos. Gladys se vale de los ingresos que recibe de esta actividad para ayudar a su esposo a solventar la economía de su familia.

Gladys desea comprar insumos para su negocio de venta de hamburguesas y salchipollo así podrá invertir para hacer crecer su negocio además desea comprar los útiles escolares de sus dos menores hijos. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Gladys, 39, is a mother living with her husband and two children in her own house located in the agricultural district of Tumán, a zone noted for sugar cane growing, located over an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

Gladys works mornings selling sweets inside the Tumán market; at night she sells hamburgers and salchipollo (fried potatoes with fried sausage and fried chicken).  She’s been in this business for several years now.  She prepares the meals at home and then offers them to the general public for sale.  The business is very well received by her customers because of the tasty way she prepares her products.  Gladys uses income earned from this activity to help her husband meet family expenses.

Gladys wants to buy ingredients for her hamburger and salchipollo sales.  She will invest to help the business grow.  In addition, she wants to buy school supplies for her two youngest children.  She has, therefore, felt it advisable to request a 2000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her meals business.

loans.name: Sirajat

texts.fr: Dame  Sirajat  est  mariée  avec  3 enfants à  charge. Elle a  37 ans.  Elle  fait  le commerce  de  produits générique  et  savons.  Elle achète les  produits  à Togo  pharma  et  les savons  au grand  marché de Lomé. Dans cette  activité,  elle  cumule  10 ans  d’expérience.  Elle  revend  à  la devanture de sa  maison. Elle  demande   un prêt  pour   répondre  à la demande  sans  cesse  croissante.
texts.en: Sirajat is married and she has 3 children in her care. She is 37 years old. She sells general products and soaps. She purchases her products in Togo Pharma and she buys soaps in the large market in Lome. She has accumulated 10 years' experience in this business. She resells from the front section of her house. She requests a loan to the demands of her ever growing clientele.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Herlinda

texts.es: Herlinda de 33 años, es una madre de familia de 2 hijos que vive en compañía de ellos en su casa propia. Hace más de 8 años decidió emprender su propio negocio, es así que decidió vender carne, queso y animales menores que trae de su pueblo natal a la ciudad donde actualmente radica. Viaja constantemente a su pueblo para suministrarse de mercadería y que luego son llevados a la ciudad. Sus ventas son al contado lo que garantiza su ganancia. En ocasiones  recibe la ayuda de sus hijos, pero la mayor parte del tiempo es ella quien lo realiza, pues le agrada trabajar ya que su fin es cubrir la múltiples necesidades de su familia; por ello se ha propuesto incrementar su capital de trabajo para tener más ganancias. Es su segundo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad. Con el crédito que solicita, podrá comprar más mercadería en quesos y también comprará carneros para incrementar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Herlinda, 33, is a mother of two children living with them in her own house.  Over 8 years ago she decided to go into business for herself.  She decided to sell meat, cheese and small farm animals that she brings from the town of her birth to the city where she currently lives.  She travels constantly to her town to stock up on merchandise to take to the city later.  Her sales are cash which guarantees profits.  Sometimes her children help her but most of the time she does all the work by herself because she enjoys working since her goal is to meet her family’s multiple needs.  Because of this she has proposed to increase her working capital in order to have more profits.

This is her second loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support since she’s always been responsible with her payments.  Besides, she enjoys being part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible, very mutually supportive people.  She thanks all those people who will fund the loan she’s requesting that will be so useful for her business’ progress.  She will use the loan to buy cheese and will also buy sheep to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To buy cheese and sheep.

loans.name: Anastasie

texts.en: Anastasie is 68 years old and has three children, two of whom she adopted. Anastasie has been selling domestic animals for nine years and is requesting a loan to reinvest in her business. She plans to renovate her house with the profits .

loans.use: To reinvest in her animal sales business

loans.name: Afi  Christine

texts.fr: Madame Christine a 35 ans et mère de  3 enfants. Pour améliorer les  conditions de vie  de  ses  enfants, elle   fait le commerce  de charbons de bois. Elle a commencé en 1994 et s’approvisionne  dans  un village  sur la route  de Kpalimé à  Kati.   Elle sollicite un prêt pour acheter  20  nouveaux sacs de charbons de  bois.
texts.en: Christine is 35 years old and the mother of 3 children. In order to improve the living condition of her children, she sells charcoal. She started out in 1994 and she makes her purchases in a village on the way to Kpalime in Kati. She requests a loan to purchase 20 sacks of charcoal.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal.

loans.name: Auxiliadora De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Auxiliadora Báez es  de la ciudad de Concepción, tiene 19 años y  está cursando el 1° año de la carrera de Obstetricia en la Universidad UNI NORTE de Concepción.
Su mamá es la sra. Arcadia R..
El crédito sale a nombre del Sr. Tomás, quien es su padre, ya que la misma todavía no cuenta con un ingreso fijo, pero el sr. Tomás firma con su señora y su hija quien es la beneficiada.
Ella solicita el préstamo para el pago de la mensualidad de su facultad y también para la compra de libros que está necesitando para estudiar.
Auxiliadora agradece este préstamo ya que le ayudará en su estudio y al mismo tiempo podrá contar con referencias crediticias que en el futuro será  de mucha importancia para concretar sus proyectos.
texts.en:
Auxiliadora Báez, 19, is from the city of Concepción.  She’s in the first year of Obstetrics at UNI NORTE University in Concepción.  Her mother is Mrs. Arcadia Rodríguez.

The loan will be issued in her father Tomás' name because she still does not have steady income.  Tomás, his wife and daughter all sign on and it’s the daughter who is the beneficiary.

She is asking for the loan to pay her monthly tuition and also to buy the books she needs for her courses.

Auxiliadora is grateful for this loan because it will help her with her studies and at the same time create credit history which in the future will be very important to carry out her projects.

loans.use: To pay tuition and other school supplies.

loans.name: Jhon Richard

texts.es:
Jhon de 32 años, comenzó como taxista hace algunos años atrás. Poco a poco en el sector donde vive lo conocen como el taxista. Trabaja desde las 16h00pm hasta las 23h00pm.  El promedio de costos de las carreras es de $ 1.00 hasta $ 10.00. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su taxi y así proveer mas dinero para sus hijos. Una de los inconvenientes es que en ocasiones se le daña el carro, por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo herramientas y llantas.
texts.en:
Jhon, 32, started working as a taxi driver a few years back.  He gradually became known as a taxi driver in the area where he lives.  He works from 4pm until 11pm.  He earns on average between $1.00 and $10.00 per trip.

He has lots of hopes for his taxi to provide more income for his children.  One of the inconveniences he faces is the occasional damage to his car.  Because of this he wants to use the loan to buy tools and tires.

loans.use: For tires and tools.

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
Doña Juana V. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo pupular, tiene una pequeña pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion la cual opera bajo el nombre de pulperia Pulpería “EMMY”.
La Sra. Juana V. paso un momento muy difícil, perdieron de manera trágica (accidente) el hijo varón que tenía y a pesar de su estado emocional, siempre a seguido trabajando para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.  
Doña Juana esta casada y su esposo se dedica a es su carro a vender tierra blanca,  actualmente de su matrimonio ya solo depende una hija de ellos.
Cabe mencionar que la Sra. V. hace la mayoría de sus ventas al crédito, casi todos sus clientes son empleados de las fábricas de tabacos y acuden a ella para que les de la mercaderia, mismos que le pagan a cuando reciben sus pagos de salario.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia y asi surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana V. sells popular consumer products.  She has a small general store located in her house, which operates under the name "Pulperia EMMY". 

Mrs. Juana V. went through a difficult time; they tragically lost their son in an accident. In spite of her emotional state, she always kept working to improve their quality of life.

Juana is married and her husband does mobile sales of diatomaceous earth.  Currently they only have one daughter who is still dependent on them.  It's worth mentioning that Mrs. V. makes the majority of her sales on credit.  Almost all of her clients are employed in the tobacco factories, and they go to her because she sells them the merchandise as long as they pay her when they get their paychecks.  

The loan will be used to buy merchandise and stock her business.

loans.use: To buy coffee, bread, rice, sugar, beans, shortening, oil, margarine, cookies, sodas, juices, spaghetti, pasta, sauces, soups, soaps, toilet paper, sanitary pads, toothpaste, and eggs.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocío es una joven de 19 años que vive al lado de sus padres y sus hermanos en una casa alquilada. Desde hace 2 años decidió emprender su propio negocio de venta de animales (carneros) que realiza en las ferias ganaderas de su localidad, en un inicio recibió el apoyo de sus padres para aprender todo lo referido a este negocio y garantizar la rentabilidad de la misma pero ahora en la actualidad  ya conoce bien y puede caminar sola en este negocio. Cada fin de semana compra carneros al por mayor, para luego venderlas a un mayor precio, y al termino del día logra vender casi todos. Le agrada desarrollar este negocio porque le permite ayudar en la economía de su hogar, a su vez le permite estudiar, es por esta razón que desea incrementar su capital de trabajo. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero que la ayudara a incrementar sus ingresos, promete ser puntual en sus pagos y agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más carneros e incrementar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Rocío is a 19 year old young woman living with her parents and siblings in a rented house. Two years ago she decided to start her own business selling animals (sheep) in the local livestock fairs.  At the beginning her parents helped her learn everything related to this business so that it would be profitable.  Now, she is well versed in it and can continue on her own.  

Every week she buys sheep at wholesale for subsequent resale at retail at a higher price; at the end of the day she’s managed to sell almost all of them.  She enjoys developing this business because it allows her to help her home’s economy as well as continue with her schooling.  Because of this she wants to increase her working capital.

This is her first loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support that will help her increase her income.  She promises to be punctual with her payments and thanks all those people who will fund the loan she’s asking for because it will be very useful for her business’ progress.  She will use the requested loan to buy more sheep and increase her working capital.

loans.use: To buy more sheep.

loans.name: Blanca Aurora

texts.es:
A sus 63 años de edad, Blanca Aurora P. de Marín, se dedica a la confección, negocio que desde hace 10 años se ha convertido en un gran apoyo para cubrir los gastos familiares. Los vecinos son sus principales clientes, pues Blanca además de confeccionar todo tipo de prendas también realiza diferentes arreglos, los cuales tienen gran acogida entre sus clientes. 

Actualmente, Blanca necesita comprar una máquina familiar debido a que la que tiene es muy antigua y no le permite elaborar rápidamente los pedidos.
texts.en:
At 63 years old, Blanca Aurora P. de Marín sews for a living.  Over the past ten years, her business has become a big help in supporting her family.  Her neighbors are her main customers.  In addition to making all types of clothes, Blanca also does different types of mending and repairs, which are popular among her customers.

Currently, Blanca needs to buy a sewing machine since the one she uses is very old and doesn't allow her to finish orders quickly.

loans.use: Buying a sewing machine

loans.name: Deysi Patricia

texts.es:
Deysi vive en Ciudad de del Este, tiene 19 años y deseos de iniciar en la univerdad en la carrera de contabilidad.
Ella tiene 2 hermanos más que aún son menores.
Su padre trabaja en una concesionaria y su madre es ama de casa.
Deysi actualmente trabaja en el microcentro como vendedora en un negocio, donde está adquiriendo experiencia y al mismo tiempo obtiene un ingreso para sus estudios.
Deysi tiene muchos deseos de terminar su carrera para poder trabajar ejerciendo su profesión.
Ella solicita el préstamo para el pago de la mensualidad de su facultad y también para la compra de libros que está necesitando para estudiar.
Deysi agradece este préstamo ya que le ayudará en su estudio y al mismo tiempo podrá contar con referencias crediticias que en el futuro será  de mucha importancia para concretar sus proyectos.
texts.en:
Deysi lives in Ciudad de Este. She is 19 years old and wants to study accounting in university.
She has two younger brothers. 
Her father works at a dealership and her mother is a housewife.
At the moment, Deysi works downtown as a salesperson in a business. She is gaining experience and at the same time, she is earning income to use for her studies.
Deysi wants to finish her degree, so she can start practicing her profession. 
She is requesting this loan to pay the monthly payment for her studies and to buy the books needed for studying.
Deysi is grateful for this loan that will help her with her studies and at the same time, she can establish credit references which will be very important for future projects.

loans.use: to pay for university enrollment and other study materials

loans.name: Pacotom Group

texts.es: Maria Candelaria C. C., tiene 27 años D. edad,  es soltera se dedica a atender un tienda D. consumo diario, lleva 7 años con este negocio, empezo a vender en la tienda cuando era niña. Quiere ampliar su capital D. trabajo, por lo que  se deciD. organizar un grupo con el fin D. solicitar un prestamo a ASDIR,que servira para ampliar el capital D. trabajo con que cuentan cada una D. las integrantes D. este grupo, se dedica a las  actividades D.: crainza D. animales, elaboracion D. canastilas D. plastico y tienda D. comnsumo diario. Maria Candelaria, espera ampliar su negopcio y que sea surtido para atender mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en:
María Candelaria C. C., 27, is single and tends to a grocery store every day; she’s had the business for 7 years.  She started selling in the store when she was a little girl.

She wants to expand her working capital so decided to organize a group to request a loan from ASDIR that will be to increase the working capital each group member has.  Among their occupations are: raising animals, making plastic baskets and a grocery store.  María Candelaria expects to expand her business so that it will be better stocked in order to proviD. better customer service.

.

loans.use: For working capital.

loans.name: Delia Maria

texts.es:
La señora Delia, de 30 años de edad, es  originaria del departamento de Estelí, es casada, tiene 2 hijos uno de 11 años y otro de 7 años de edad. Actualmente vive e el Barrio José Zelaya, fui ahí donde comenzó su negocio de tomar fotografía con la cámara que su padre le dejo cuando se fue a Canadá. Lleva 10 años trabajando como fotografía  y 8 años  trabajando con una discomóvil. En el año 2003 comenzó su negocio de la disco móvil con ayuda de su esposo y los ingresos obtenidos del  estudio d fotografía.  Primero comenzaron comprando un parlante pequeño y un amplificador con los cuales realizaban  trabajos en actividades pequeñas como  promociones escolares y  cumpleaños,  con el paso del tiempo este negocio fue creciendo, ahora la disco cuenta con 2 poderes ,12 parlantes grandes ,1 juego de 8 luces con los cuales realizan actividades de animación de eventos en las comarcas y municipio de Estelí como 15 años,  boda, cumpleaños, aniversarios. Actualmente tanto su esposo y ella son lo únicos que trabajan en su negocio  es decir se ayudan mutuamente. 
Solicita el crédito para comprar una computadora y una impresora para imprimir, revelar fotos, descargar fotografías de cámaras digitales, luces y un equipo para producir humo de animación en la disco.
El crédito le ayudara en la compra de equipo para mejorar la atención y servicio a sus clientes y obtener buenas ganancias que le permitan ahorrar lo suficiente para poder darles estudios universitarios a sus hijos que actualmente están en la primaria , ya que ella solo pudo llegar hasta 2año de la secundaria. Una vez terminado el crédito, le gustaría invertir para ir cambiando y actualizando su negocio en cuanto a equipos como; cámara, parlantes, poderes y luces, hacerlo prosperar cada día.
texts.en:
Mrs. Delia is 30 years old, from the department of Estelí, married and has two children ages 11 and 7.  She currently lives in the José Zelaya district where she began her photography business with the camera her father gave her when he went to Canada.  She's been working in photography for 10 years and running a mobile discoteque for 8 years.  In 2003 she set up her mobile disco with the help of her husband and the income from her photography business.  They began by buying a small speaker system and amplifier for small jobs such as school graduations and birthdays.  With time the business grew and the disco now has 2 disc jocky stations, 12 large speakers, a set of 8 lights that they use for events (coming-out parties, weddings, birthdays, anniversaries) in the counties and municipality of Estelí.   For now she and her husband are the only ones working in the business.

She plans to use the loan to buy a computer and printer to dowload and print photographs from digital cameras.  She'll also buy lighting and equipment to produce a smokey atmosphere for the disco.

The loan will buy the equipment necessary to provide the best attention and service to customers.  This will generate more earnings that will be put toward savings for college for her children who are now in primary school.  Delia was only able to reach her second year in secondary school.  Once she has paid back the loan she would like to invest in updating her business and making it more profitable by purchasing different kinds of equipment: camera, speaker, DJ station and lighting.

loans.use: To buy a computer and printer to download and print digital photos, and light fixtures and equipment to produce a smokey discoteque atmosphere

loans.name: Ekua Mensah Elizabeth

texts.en:
Ekua Mensah Elizabeth G., who completed senior high school, is married to a driver and the mother of three children. Ekua assists her husband in feeding, clothing and educating the children.

For the past six years she has been selling clothes as a peddler at Kokowada near Elmina, and the loan she is requesting will be added to her capital to buy varieties of clothes to meet the demands of her customers. Ekua's business objective is to build a shop where she can display her clothes for sale.

loans.use: To add to her capital to buy varieties of clothes to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Adwoa Enyimfa

texts.en: For six years Adwoa Enyimfa G. has been selling corn in both small and large quantities at Kokowada, near Elmina. Adwoa, who has five dependents,  contributes to the general well-being of the home. As the price of goods keeps increasing, her loan will help her to buy additional bags of corn. The extra profit accruing from the loan will be used to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy additional bags of corn

loans.name: Efua Eizabeth

texts.en:
Efua Eizabeth B., who has five dependents, is married to a farmer and together they feed, clothe and educate their children. Efua sells locally-made lamps and food items such as palm fruits at Kokowada, near Elmina. Demand for food items is increasing, so she is requesting a loan to buy extra food and additional items requested by her customers.

Efua uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. She plans to reinvest the new profits from her expanded business back into her enterprise.

In the picture Efua is shown holding a sample of the locally-made lamp,

loans.use: To buy extra food items and additional products requested by her customers.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena B. is married and has two children. She has attained junior high level of education. Abena sells plastic bowls by moving from door to door at Kokowada near Elmina in Cape Coast. Her husband is a farmer. A loan will help her buy in larger quantity to be able to supply her customers. The income generated from her sales is added to the income of her husband to take care of the children. Abena anticipates using the increase as a result of the loan to build a shop.

loans.use: buy in larger quantity

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
For the past 4 years Abena E. has been selling slippers at Kokowada near Elmina in Cape Coast. She is married and has three children. She has received junior high education. Her husband is a driver. She contributes to the payment of school fees and other expenses.

 Abena will use the loan to purchase more slippers to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Abena plans to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: purchase more slippers

loans.name: Abena Akyiniba

texts.en:
Abena Akyiniba A. is a single parent taking care of 7 dependents. Abena is into multiple businesses such as baking, smoking fish, selling maize and selling corn dough at Kokowada near Elmina in Cape Coast. A loan will enable her to buy more bags of maize so she can supply all her customers who request maize. She has been in this trade for 10 years.

 As part of her responsibility,  Abena contributes to the general up-keep of the home. The new profit from the money will be used to buy a plot of land. In this picture, she is showing the wet corn she will be using for the corn dough.

loans.use: buy more bags of maize

loans.name: Pitiriba Maame

texts.en: For the past six years, Pitiriba Maame S.  has been preparing porridge for sale. She serves this porridge with bread and milk at Kokowada near Elmina in Cape Coast. She is a single parent taking care of three children. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more ingredients to prepare porridge and other items to expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: buy more ingredients to prepare porridge

loans.name: Ama Esi Alice

texts.en:
Ama Esi Alice A. is a single mother who is currently taking care of four children. She is a baker and she bakes foods such as bread, pies, rock buns and others at Kokowada near Elmina in Cape Coast. Ama pays the household expenses with the income she makes from her sales. 

Ama will use the loan to purchase bags of flour and other ingredients which will enable her to bake in large quantities for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans buy a modern oven so she can do away with the traditional oven.

loans.use: purchase bags of flour and other ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This borrower is 34 years old, married, and has a child. The borrower graduated from industrial school (vocational department). The borrower will use this loan to purchase a sewing machine and cloth. The borrower has an upstanding character and lot of experience in her field of work, and she has a lot of clients, so she has a huge ambition to develop her business.

loans.use: purchasing sewing machine & cloth

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi W. is married to a farmer and has attained junior high level of education. She takes care of 7 dependents at Kokowada near Elmina in Cape Coast. She sells traditional beads and jewelry by moving from one locality to another. She assists her husband in the education of her dependents. Her loan, she says, will be invested in the jewelry business so she can expand her supply. She has the plan of building a jewelry shop.

loans.use: invest in the costume jewelry business

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi M. sells banku--a staple in the Ghanaian diet made from fermented corn dough--in Kokowada, Elmina. She has been in this trade for a decade. 

Married to a farmer, she has six children. They are dependent on her income to pay for school fees and household utility bills. She needs a loan to expand her business to increase her earnings. She plans to use the loan to purchase larger quantities of corn so that she can increase her banku production. The extra earnings will be used for her children’s education.

loans.use: To expand her business to increase her earnings

loans.name: Grace Mensah Akosua

texts.en:
Grace Mensah Akosua A. sells food in Kokowada near Elmina, Cape Coast. The food she sells includes rice, waakye (a traditional rice dish cooked with beans), and macaroni. 

Married with two children, she supplements what her husband earns as a farmer with her income, which is used to pay for their children’s school fees. She requires a loan to grow her business and earnings. Grace intends to use the loan to purchase more ingredients so that she can prepare more food for sale. She plans to reinvest the profits into her business for further growth.

loans.use: To grow her business and earnings

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This borrower is 41 years old, married and has two children. He graduated from primary school, and he owns a garage for repair and painting of cars. The borrower will use this loan to develop his business and purchase paints and new equipment for painting. He has a great deal of experience in his field of work. He has a good personality and has great motivation and ambition to develop his business.

loans.use: purchasing paint and other materials

loans.name: Banco Amigas Group

texts.es:
Ana forma parte del Banco comunal “Banco Amigas” conformado por 22 emprendedoras, que se desempeñan en los rubros de amasandería, artesanía, podología, ventas de ropa usada y cosméticos por catalogo, pertenecientes a la ciudad de Chillán.
Ana, quien en la foto se encuentra en la última fila, al medio, viste de polera estampada con el cuello de la polera de color negro, además usa anteojos y tiene el cabello tomado. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y cosmetología por catalogo desde hace 8 años. Además  prepara empanadas, pan amasado y pie de limón, los cuales vende puerta a puerta. 
Ana es jefa de hogar y tiene a su cuidado a tres sobrinos, ya que lamentablemente su hermana falleció el año pasado. Es por esto su motivación de seguir en el rubro del comercio de cosméticos y haciendo masas, ya que con éste aumenta sus ingresos.
Con éste préstamo comprará un local con 2 socias más y arreglará su bicicleta, ya que es su medio de transporte para trasladar sus productos.
El sueño de ana es que sus sobrinos tengan una vida grata y confortable. Dos de ellos estudian en la Universidad y su otra sobrina estudia aún en la enseñanza media. Respecto a su negocio le gustaría tener un local a futuro de su propiedad. 
Ella está muy agradecida de Fondo Esperanza le gusta mucho participar de las reuniones, ya que con las socias comparten juntas, se han conocido y han generado lazos de amistad.
En cuanto al financiamiento que recibe por medio de Fondo Esperanza, ha sido un gran aporte para su negocio, ya que con este ha podido invertir más y aumentar sus ingresos. Además le han enseñado a distribuir sus ganancias.
Chillán es una comuna de la zona centro sur de Chile. Su nombre significa “silla del sol” en mapudungun, idioma de nuestros indígenas mapuches. Chillán es conocida como “Cuna de la Patria” o “Tierra de Artistas”, debido a que en la ciudad han nacido destacados personajes de la historia de Chile, como por ejemplo el conocido pianista Claudio Arrau.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the "Banco Amigas" communal bank which is comprised of 22 entrepreneurs who work in lace-making, crafts, podology, used clothing sales, and catalogue cosmetics sales.  They all live in the city of Chillán.

In the photo Ana is shown in the last row, toward the middle, wearing a printed top with a black collar.  She wears glasses and has her hair pulled back.  For eight years she has been selling beauty products and cosmetics by catalogue.  She also makes meat pies, bread, and lemon pie which she sells door-to-door.  Ana is the head of household in her home and she takes care of her niece and nephews since she lost her sister tragically last year.  This is why she wants to keep up with her cosmetics and baked goods businesses in order to increase her income.  She plans to use the loan to buy a place for shop with two partners and also fix her bicycle which she uses to transport her merchandise.

Ana's dream is to provide a comfortable lifestyle for her niece and nephews. The boys are in college and the niece is still in middleschool.  She would like to have her own store in the future.

She is grateful to the Esperanza Fund and enjoys participating in the meetings with the other members with whom she now has a good friendship.  The financial support received from the Esperanza Fund has been very helpful for her business since she has been able to invest more and increase her income.  She also has learned how to distribute her earnings.

Chillán is a municipality in the central part of southern Chile.  It's name means "seat of the sun" in mapudungun, the language of the mapuche indians.  Chillán is known as the "Country Birthplace" or "Land of Artists" because many historical Chilean figures were born in this city, such as Claudio Arrau.

loans.use: To buy a store and for personal use

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This borrower is 34 years old, married and has three children. He graduated from intermediate school and has a shop selling paintings and antiques. He will use this loan to develop his shop and purchase wood to make frames for the paintings. The borrower has an upstanding character in the market and has a great deal of experience in his job.

loans.use: purchasing wood for frames

loans.name: Pedro Rafael

texts.es:
Pedro es un padre de familia de cuatro hijos, labora como guarda de seguridad, desde hace varios años, de edad avanzada pero con el deseo de mejorar su casa. Que lo ha venido logrando con financiamiento que Afodenic ha dado por  medio de préstamos lo cual está contento. Por realizar estas mejora que logra a pagar en plazos.
Lo que quiere hacer con su casa es levantar un poco más las paredes ya que es muy baja, el nivel de techo, en donde comprara: bloques, cemento, láminas de zinc, golosos, para su construcción.
texts.en:
Pedro is a father of 4 children and has worked as a security guard for some years.  He is of an advanced age, but still wants to improve his house, which he has been doing bit by bit with the financing that Afodenic has given him via the loans.  He is happy to have been able to make these improvements that he has paid for in stages.  

What he would like to do is raise the walls a little more, since the roof is very low.  He will need to buy: cinder-blocks, cement, sheets of tin, and bolts for the construction.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to raise the walls and roof of his house

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
Enrique es un padre de familia, que ha venido haciendo las mejoras a su casa, para un bienestar familiar, siendo de bajo recursos económicos, labora en un colegio público como guarda de seguridad, haciendo horas extras también para mejorar sus ingresos, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien vende frutas en el colegio, lo que logran equilibrar sus gastos básicos.
Enrique ha mejorado su pequeña casa, ha repellado las paredes, mejoro el baño, así como un pequeño muro en la parte de enfrente. Hoy con esta nueva solicitud hará el portón para mejor seguridad, y embaldosar su casa lo que está contento ya que solo atreves de estos financiamientos que Afodenic ha otorgado ha logrado estas mejoras. Materiales a comprar: arena, cemento, tubos, hierro, soldadura.
texts.en:
Enrique is a father who has been making improvements to his home for his family's well-being.  They have few economic resources.  He works in a public school as a security guard, and works overtime to increase his income.  He has the support of his wife who sells fruit at the school, which helps them to cover their basic needs.

Enrique has improved their small house, plastering the walls, improving the bathroom, and adding a small wall in front.  Today with this new loan request he will make a gate for increase security, and tile his house.  He is happy because only through these loans that Afodenic has provided him has he achieved these improvements.  Materials to be bought: sand, cement, tubes, iron, solder.

loans.use: To invest in a gate for greater security, and tile for the living room floor.

loans.name: Glenda Elyzabeth

texts.es:
Glenda es una madre de familia muy activa al negocio, durante un periodo de siete años viene vendiendo ropa, cosméticos, prendas de plata, comenzando con pocos productos con un ahorro proveniente de su esposo quien es cadete de taxi.
Comienza a aumentar su inventario atreves de los financiamiento que Afodednic ha dado en siete ciclos, en donde ha logrado la captación de clientes, aumentaron sus ventas, adquirió la compra de vitrinas para tener más demanda al exhibir sus cosméticos. El cual vende al contado y al crédito.
Con este nuevo préstamo comprara: cosméticos variados, ropa escolar, zapatos y seguir rotando sus ventas como productos.
texts.en:
Glenda is a mother and very active in her business. Over a 7 year period she has sold clothes, cosmetics, and silver jewelry.  She began with only a few products with savings provided by her husband who is a taxi driver in training.  

She began to increase her inventory thanks to the loans that Afodednic has given her in 7 cycles, through which she has achieved a greater client base, increase her sales, and acquired glass cases to increase demand by exhibiting her cosmetics.  She sells on cash and credit.  

With this new loan she will buy: various cosmetics, school clothing, shoes, and continue rotating her products.

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of clothing, shoes and various cosmetic products to increase sales

loans.name: Sonia Marina

texts.es:
Sonia habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua, se dedica al comercio de elaboración de tortillas con doce años en las ventas, así como productos lácteos como: cuajada, crema, queso, frijoles cocidos, logrando tener mejores ingreso.
Inicio con el objetivo de apoyar  a su familia,  vendiendo solo tortillas, luego con la ganancia y préstamo que Afodenic otorgo comienza a incrementar la producción de tortillas y ventas de lácteos.
Sonia palmea los tres tiempos y tiene  a dos jóvenes palmeando, ya que aumentado su clientela. Lo que invertirá con su nuevo financiamiento el aumento de maíz, compra de leña, frijoles, y lácteos.
texts.en:
Sonia lives in a neighborhood in the capital of Managua.  She makes tortillas, and has been selling them for 12 years along with dairy products such as cuajada (a soft cheese), cream, cheese, as well as cooked beans, which have helped increase her income.

She began with the objective of supporting her family, just selling tortillas.  Later with the earnings and the loan that Afodenic gave her she began to increase the production of tortillas and to sell dairy products.  

Sonia makes tortillas for breakfast, lunch and dinner, and has two young people who help her since her clientele are increasing.  With the new loan she will buy more corn, firewood, beans and dairy products.

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of corn, beans, and dairy products to improve her income

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es:
Doña Alba V. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pequeña pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion la cual opera bajo el nombre de Pulpería “LAS GEMELITAS”.

El crecimiento en su negocio es notable al igual sus condiciones de vida han mejorado.
Doña Alba esta casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura (siembra de maíz y frijoles) y también es pastor de una Iglesia evangélica lo que hace una familia con buenos principios cristianos; del matrimonio han procreado 4 hijos los cuales depende en su totalidad de ellos, cubriendo junto a su esposo los gastos de alimentación, vestuario, educación y salud. 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Doña Alba V. sells groceries out of a small store called "LAS GEMELITAS" that she runs out of her home.  Her business has grown considerably and her living conditions have improved.

Doña Alba is married and her husband is a farmer who raises corn and beans.  He is also the pastor of the Evangelical church and therefore the family has good Christian values.  They have four children who depend on them for their food, clothing, education and health expenses.

She plans to use the loan to buy goods to stock her grocery store.

loans.use: To buy coffee, bread, cookies, beans, softdrinks, juices, rice, sugar, lard, oil, margarine, toilet tissue, eggs, toothpaste, soups, pasta, soap, sweets

loans.name: Maria Deysi

texts.es:
La Señorita Maria Deysi C. V., es una persona de 22 años de edad, soltera, bachiller en humanidades, vive con sus padres, es agricultora produce papa, haba, arveja, maíz (choclo), cebada y realiza la transformación de la papa en chuño aprovechando la época de invierno en la comunidad de Manzana Rancho - Tíraque que está distante aproximadamente a unos 70 Km. desde la ciudad de Cochabamba. Sus padres son personas trabajadoras por ejemplo; el padre recientemente ingreso a trabajar en una empresa constructora en calidad de excavador y la madre trabaja junto a ella en la actividad agropecuaria, pero aprovechando sus tiempos libres especialmente los días de feria de la población de Sacaba - Cochabamba, realiza la reventa de papa y otros productos por los cuales genera un ingreso económico adicional y de tal forma mejorar las condiciones de vida de la familia. 

Asimismo la clienta y sus padres manifiestan tener el deseo de comprar otro terreno agrícola para poder incrementar su producción y a partir de esto mejorar sus ingresos económicos; para tal efecto se ven en la necesidad de solicitar capital de inversión  para adquirir en calidad de compra el mencionado terreno agrícola.
texts.en:
Miss Maria Deysi C. V. is 22 years old, single and has a Bachelor of Humanities degree.  She lives with her parents and is a farmer raising potatoes, lima beans, peas, corn and barley.  She also makes freeze-dried potatoes in the winter months in the Manzana Rancho - Tíraque community which is about 70 kms. from the city of Cochabamba.  Her parents are very hard workers.  Her father recently started a job as an excavator for a construction company.  Her mother works with her in the farming activity and also uses her free time to travel to the market in the town of Sacaba - Cochabama where she sells the potatoes and other products which generate even more income allowing the family to improve their living conditions.

Maria Deysi and her parents wish to buy farmland to increase production and income and so plan to use the loan for this purpose.

loans.use: To buy farmland

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
Doña Maria C. se dedica a la venta de abarroteria, tiene una pequeña pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion, su negocio opera bajo el nombre de Pulpería “GINA”.

Cabe mencionar que la Sra. C. la mayoría de sus ventas las hace al crédito, por que casi todos sus clientes son empleados de fábricas y le pagan a ella cuando reciben su salario mensual.

La Sra. Maria C. esta casada y de su matrimonio solo depende un hijo, su cónyuge se dedica a la agricultura (siembra de maíz y frijoles). en la zona donde ellos viven es muy buena para la producción de granos básicos.

En la actualidad Doña Maria no cuenta con el capital de trabajo suficiente para surtir su negocio y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia al por mayor y asi surtir su negocio para obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Doña María C. has a small grocery store that she operates out of her home under the name "GINA" Grocery.

Most of her sales are made on a credit basis since nearly all of her customers are factory workers who pay her at the end of the month.

Mrs. Maria C. is married and has a son.  Her husband is a farmer (corn and beans).  They live in an area that is very good for growing basic grains.

At this moment Doña Maria does not have enough working capital to stock her business well and satisfy customer demand.  She plans to use the credit to buy goods wholesale so she can increase her inventory and generate more income.

loans.use: To buy softdrinks, pastry, bread, cookies, flour, beans, lard, oil, margarine, rice, sugar, salt, condiments, pasta, soup, tomato sauce, cereal, soap, toilet tissue, candles, matches, batteries, juices, sweets

loans.name: Tito

texts.es:
Tito M. S. vende el mejor Queso de la  comunidad de la Fuente  en Cartago.
El tiene muchos años de dedicarse  a la ganadería  de doble propósito, donde su principal producto es el queso.  Sin embargo el quiere que su negocio siga creciendo y para eso quiere comprar otra vaca lechera, con un préstamo de ₡400 000 (Cuatrocientos mil colones).
Su meta principal es obtener mayores ingresos para fortalecerse como microempresario.
El es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal  la Fuente Agrícola  Empresarial, una de las  110 empresas de Crédito Socias de EDESA.
texts.en:
Tito M. S. sells the best cheese in the community of Fuente in Cartago. 

He has many years in dual purpose cattle farming, but the primary product is cheese. He wants to keep his business growing and to do so he needs to purchase another dairy cow, with a loan of 400 000 (four hundred thousand colones). 

His primary goal is to obtain a better income to become a stronger small business owner. 

He is a member of the communal bank named "La Fuente Agricola Empresarial", one of the 110 member associations of Edesa (Kiva Field Partner).

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Patzolojche Group

texts.es: Doña Francisca C. L., es casada, tiene 51 años de edad, tiene 10 hijos, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, se dedica a la crianza de animales, empezo a hacer este oficio cuando tenia 45 años de edad, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es aserrador, y tiene 5 años de experiencia con este trabajo, organiza un grupo con el fin de solicitar un prestamo para invertirlo como capital de trabajo en este caso la compra de animales pequeños y criarlos para posteriormente venderlos, sueñan con ver un negocio grande para el futuro.
texts.en: Francisca C. L. is married, 51 years old, and she has 10 children. She did not have the opportunity to go to school. She raises livestock. She started this business when she was 45 years old with the support of her husband, a shepherd. She has 5 years' experience in the business. She organized a group with the intent of requesting a loan to invest as working capital, which in this case is the purchase of small livestock to raise and sell. They dream of a large business in the future.

loans.use: To use as working capital

loans.name: María Gladys

texts.es:
María tiene 43 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su familia en el caserío Vallecito ubicado en el  en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Ella cuenta con una bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí el ofrece en venta a sus vecinos diversos productos de consumo diario entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta con una antigüedad de algunos años y actualmente cuenta con una clientela fija y fidelizada. Gracias a esta actividad ella ha podido ayudar a su esposo a mantener a su familia y sacarla adelante durante todo este tiempo.

María desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Maria is 43 years old, married, and she lives with her family in the community of Vallecito, located in the district of Tambogrande, an agricultural region situated in the Province of Piura and the region of the same name. It is more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital city of Lambayeque. 

She has a convenience store installed in her house. There she sells to her neighbors various products of daily use, basic needs products, and groceries. Her business is a few years old and today she has a steady and loyal clientele. Thanks to this business she has been able to help her husband support the family and to come through during all this time.

Maria wants to expand her business with the purchase of more merchandise in order to satisfy the demand of her clients. For this reason she has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
La Sra. Irma R. tiene 55 años de edad, vive en el Benque Jamastran y se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pequeña pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion la cual opera bajo el nombre de  Pulpería “IRMA”.

el crecimiento de su negocio es notable y sus condiciones han mejorado.
La Sra. R. utilizara el crédito para comprar mas mercaderia y asi surtir su negocio.
 
Doña Irma es madre soltera, ya que tiene 17 años de haberse separado de su compañero de hogar, pero esto no le a quitado el deseo de seguir trabajando y superarse, criando a sus hijos sola, de los cuales uno ya trabaja y  ya solo dependen tres hijos de ella.
texts.en:
Irma R. is 55 years old and she lives in Benque Jamastran. She sells daily use products from a convenience store located in her house. The name of the convenience store is "Irma".

The growth of the business is noticeable and her situation has improved.  Mrs. R. will use her loan to purchase more merchandise to stock her business. 

Irma is a single mother, having been separated from her partner for 17 years. But this has not stopped her from wanting to keep on working, raising her children alone. One of her children already works and only three of them depend on her.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Tito

texts.es: Tito tiene 38 años, vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde que era una niña aprendió a trabajar en la tierra, sembrando y cuidando de las plantas que era productos para su sostenibilidad familiar, y hasta en la actualidad es la fuente de ingresos económicos más importante. Por otro lado, también vende productos alimenticios como: maca, mashua, olluco entre otros, permitiéndole tener más ventas al por mayor en las ferias comerciales de su localidad. Siempre trabajo al lado de su esposa y sus hijos durante 10 años, y eso le ha dado la ventaja de tener una economía estable, y por ello continuará adelante con esta actividad, con la meta de comprar más terrenos para cultivar. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contento y motivado de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero y agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para su próxima campaña de siembra.
texts.en: Tito is 38 years old and he lives with his wife and three children in a house of their own. Since he was a boy he learned to work the fields, sowing and taking care of the plants that would produce the products that would support the family. And until today it continues to be his most important source of income. Concurrently, he also sells food products, such as: maca tubers, mashua tubers, and potatoes. This gives him the opportunity to sell more in wholesale at the fairs in his community. For the last 10 years he has worked alongside his wife and children and this has given them the advantage of a steady family economy. For this reason he will continue working his business, with the goal of purchasing more land to cultivate. This is his first loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and he is very happy and motivated to know that he has financial support. He is thankful to all those individuals who will contribute towards the loan he requests. It will be very useful for the progress of his business. With the loan he requests, he will invest in the purchase of sacks of fertilizer for the next growing season.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Rosa Escarleth

texts.es: Rosa Escarleth tiene 30 años, su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 3 años que inicio con esta actividad, Ella siempre ha sido una mujer luchadora y emprendedora. Por lo que es la primera vez que solicita créditos y se siente muy contenta con esta oportunidad. Actualmente solicita este financiamiento con el fin de invertir en nuevos productos que sus clientes más jóvenes solicitan. Su deseo es mejorar los ingresos para su familia y proporcionarle condiciones necesarias.
texts.en:
30-year old Rosa Escarleth earns her living by selling cosmetics, a business she started three years ago. She’s always been a hardworking and enterprising person. This is the first time that she has asked for a loan and feels very happy to have an opportunity like this.

Rosa plans to use the loan to buy the new products that her younger customers are asking for. Her greatest wish is to increase her income so that she can provide her family with the necessities of life.

loans.use: to buy new products for her cosmetics business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to have his car refitted

loans.name: Diego Froylan

texts.es:
Diego, de 19 años, vive en la casa de su pareja Mariza (20), al lado de ella y de sus suegros; aunque todavía no tiene hijos a diario se esfuerza por salir adelante. 

Desde hace dos años, este trabajador joven se dedica a la venta de bolsas, al por mayor, y ya tiene clientes fijos a los que ofrece su mercadería. Cuando era pequeño ayudaba a sus padres en esta labor pero ya se ha independizado con sus propias ganancias. Manifiesta que la mayoría de sus clientes  se encuentran en grandes mercados y él se va muy temprano a los lugares y reparte la cantidad de bolsas que le han pedido. Aunque afirma que el trabajo es algo cansado, su esfuerzo se recompensa con las regulares ganancias que percibe de las ventas diarias. Además en la actualidad esta terminando de estudiar la secundaria, pues su máximo anhelo es estudiar mecánica en un instituto de prestigio, pues quiere continuar progresando con una profesión y continuar superándose. 

Diego tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería en bolsas pues quiere abastecer mejor a sus clientes, y calcula que sus ganancias aumentaran bastante.

Es el segundo  crédito que tiene con MFP y promete cumplir con sus cuotas puntualmente en agradecimiento a todas las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso.
texts.en:
19-year old Diego lives in his 20-year old partner Mariza’s house along with her parents. Although he doesn't yet have children, he works hard every day to get ahead. 

For two years now this hardworking young man has been selling bags wholesale. He already has regular customers for his products. When he was a young boy, he used to help his parents in this same work but then he started his own business and earned his own money. Most of his customers are located in the large markets so he goes there very early in the morning to deliver the bags they have ordered. Although the work is tiring, his hard work pays off in providing him with a steady income.

As well as this work, Diego is in the process of completing his secondary education. His greatest wish is to study medicine at a good university as he wishes to have a career and continue making progress in life. 

Diego plans to use the loan to buy more bags so that he has a wider stock to offer his customers; he estimates that this will bring in more income too. This is his second loan with Kiva partner MFP and he promises to make the repayments punctually in appreciation of the people who made the loan possible. The money will allow him to continue to seek a better future.

loans.use: to buy more bags for his wholesale business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio tiene  43 años, vive con su esposo y sus 5 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales, asimismo se dedica a la agricultura y en la venta de chatarra. De esta manera, es como se genera ingresos, durante los fines de semana compra y vende animales; mientras que en su casa tiene un pequeño establo que le permite guardar a sus animales, donde los aguarda en caso de que no ser vendidos. En tanto los días de semana, compra y vende chatarra, en esta actividad cuenta con la ayuda de algunos amigos que también recorre la calle con el fin de obtener chatarra. En adelante desea incrementar su capital de trabajo. Es su segundo crédito con MFP, esta muy contento de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos y agradece a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará insumos para la agricultura como sacos de abono y semillas.
texts.en:
Antonio, age 43, lives with his wife and their five children in his own house.  He has been raising and selling animals for four years.  He also farms and sells junk.  That is how he generates income.  On the week-ends he buys and sells animals.  He has a small stable at his house that allows him to keep his animals if they are not sold.

On week days he buys and sells junk.  He has the help of some of his friends in this business activity.  They scour the streets in order to get junk.

In the future he wants to increase his work capital.  This is his second loan with MFP.  He is very happy to know that he has financial support.  He has always demonstrated that he is responsible with his payments.  He is grateful to the people who will be the lenders of the loan he is requesting.  It will be of great use in the progress of his business.  He will use the requested loan to buy farming supplies like sacks of fertilizer and seeds.

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Andrea Lisbett

texts.es:
Andrea es comerciante ambulante de venta de comidas rápidas, frutas, golosinas, el cual tiene un bajarete con mantas en un andén frente a un banco.  Permitiéndole vender  a los trabajadores y lograr clientela, ya que es un lugar frecuentado por muchas personas, al hacer transacciones.
Ha venido mejorando en lo económico ya que ahora tiene más sólido sus pequeñas ventas, con financiamiento que Afodenic dio, a plazos el cual equilibra sus gastos para poder pagar en tiempo y forma sus gastos.
Con este nuevo financiamiento aumentara la venta de comida, gaseosas, golosinas, frutas,carne, pollos y otros  obteniendo mejores ventas, y mejores márgenes de ganancias ya que tiene seis hijos que cuidar.
texts.en:
Andrea is a street vendor of fast foods, fruits, and sweets, which she sells from a kiosk with tablecloths on a sidewalk in front of a bank. This is where she sells to workers and gets her customers, because many people come to this area to do their bank transactions.

She has been improving her economic situation now that her small business is more stable. With the financing she received from Afodenic, she has been able to balance her expenses and make her payments on time.

With this new loan, she will increase her sales of soft drinks, sweets, fruits, meats, chicken, and other items. Better sales and improved income margins will help since she has six children to take care of.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, sweets, fruits, meats, chicken, and other items

loans.name: Yadira Lineth

texts.es:
la sra. Yadira Lineth M. R. tiene 23 años de edad, vive en el Barrio Tierra Blanca de la ciudad de danli, Yadira se dedica a la venta de utiles escolares, sus clientes son los alumnos de varios colegios de esta ciudad. tiene la ayuda de su esposo para la atencion de sus clientes.
en estos momentos es la epoca escolar y muchos padres de familia estan comprando utiles para sus hijos.
Yadira utilizara el credito para comprar mas utiles al por mayor, con esto obtendra mejores precios de compra y tendra mayores ganancias.
desea tener bien surtido su negocio ya que la demanda es bastante y no quiere quedarse corta con la mercaderia.
nos comento que se siente muy feliz ya que su negocio cada dia va creciendo y luce mejor.
texts.en:
Yadira Lineth M. R. is 23 years old and lives in Tierra Blanca neighborhood of the city of Danlí.  Yadira's business is selling school supplies.  Her customers are students from several schools in the city.  Yadira's husband helps her to serve her customers.  Right now it is the back-to-school season and many parents are buying supplies for their children.

Yadira will use this loan to buy more school supplies wholesale.  This will enable her to obtain her products for better prices and she will make more profit.  She would like to have her business well stocked since demand is quite high and she doesn't want to be left without enough merchandise.  Yadira tells us that she feels very happy since her business is growing and improving every day.

loans.use: To buy exercise books, pencils, erasers, pencil sharpeners, correction fluid, markers, sheets of paper, paper products, glue, school bags, backpacks, paper cutters, pens, lead for propelling pencils.

loans.name: Sarita

texts.es: Sarita Tiene 20 años, vive en casa de unos familiares con su hijo pequeño. Hace más de 6 meses se dedica a la compra y venta de animales en las ferias ganaderas de su zona, uno de sus familiares la ayuda en esta tarea ya que siempre es necesario trasladar sus animales al puesto de venta. Ella consigue los animales a un menor precio, de esa manera garantiza su margen de ganancias, que le servirá para los gastos de la semana, durante este tiempo ha visto que sus ganancias le son rentables por lo que desea aumentar su capital de trabajo. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más animales al por mayor.
texts.en:
Sarita is 20 years old.  She lives in a family member's home with her young child.  For more than 6 months, Sarita has been buying and selling animals in livestock markets in her area.  One of her family members helps her in her work since it is always necessary to transport her animals to her sales location.  She acquires her animals at a lower price and, in this way, she guarantees her profit margin which helps her cover her weekly expenses.  

Over the time she has been in this business, Sarita has seen that it is profitable and so she would like to increase her working capital.  This is her first loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support.  She likes being a member of her community bank because all the members are responsible people who are very supportive of each other.  She is grateful to those who will help fund her loan because it will be very useful to her in making progress in her business.  She will invest the loan she is requesting in buying more animals wholesale.

loans.use: To buy more small animals

loans.name: Miurel Del Socorro

texts.es:
Miurel del Socorro vive con una hermanaes en Nueva Guinea, se desempeña de docente, impartiendo sus clases con gran dedicacion y esmero, es una persona muy resonsable y estudiosa, actualmente finalizo su estudios en licenciatura de Biologia, desde pequeña a realizado el efuerzo por salir adelante en los estudios, obtiene ingreso de su actividad permitiendole desarrollarse y ampliar sus conocimientos. 

Solicita su crédito con el apoyo de Kiva para realizar un baño y bodega esto le permitira tener mejores condiciones y dar mayor valor de mercado a su casa. 

Su mayor sueño es que su vivienda luzca bonita y con todas las condiciones que se necesita en ella para un vivir mejor.
texts.en:
Miurel del Socorro lives with her sisters in Nueva Guinea. She works as a teacher, giving her classes with great dedication and care. She is a very responsible and studious person. She is currently finishing her bachelor’s degree in biology. From the time she was a young girl, she worked hard in her studies. She earns a living by teaching, which allows her to develop as a person and increase her knowledge. 

She is requesting a loan, with the support of Kiva, to add a bathroom and a storage room in her house. This will allow her to live in better conditions and will also add market value to her house. 

Her greatest dream is for her house to look nice and have all of the conditions necessary for a better life.

loans.use: To build a bathroom and a storage room

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a larger quantity of bags

loans.name: María  Laura

texts.es:
María tiene 32 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su esposo y sus dos menores hijos en el distrito de Mochumí, una zona agrícola bastante comercial que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque, se encuentra situada a más de media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

María se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores  y aves de corral, los cría en un corral situado posterior a su domicilio. Ella los alimenta de granos y pastos naturales, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentemente visitan la zona en donde reside. Adicionalmente ella se dedica a la preparación y venta de chicha de jora en su domicilio desde hace tres años y lo ofrece a los vecinos de la zona.

El desea adquirir más animales porque ha aumentado su demanda y así percibir mayores ingresos, además desea comprar insumos para seguir preparando la chicha de jora que posteriormente le permitirá seguir con su negocio. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
María is 32 years old, married, and lives together with her husband and two dependent children in Mochumí district, a relatively commercial agricultural area in Lambayeque province which is located more than half an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

María's business is raising and selling small animals and poultry.  She raises her animals in a pen which is located behind her home.  She feeds them grains and natural pasture.  When they have reached a good level of development she offers them for sale to the traders who often visit her area.  María also prepares and sells 'chicha de jora' (a corn-based drink) from her home.  She has been doing this for three years, selling to her neighbors.

María would like to acquire more animals because demand has risen.  In this way, she hopes to make more profits.  She would also like to buy supplies so that she can continue preparing her 'chicha de jora'.  This will allow her to continue in her business.  She has requested a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to help her achieve her goal.

loans.use: To buy more animals

loans.name: Johana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Esta joven habitante de Nueva Guinea, es casada, madre de un hijo de 13 años de edad, quien realiza estudios de secundaria, Johana es una profesional y desarrolla su función en la radio Manatial, tiene de trabajar 18 años, es asesora de venta de donde obtiene sus ingresos para salir adelanto con su hijo, ademas cuenta con una pequeña libreria que tambien le genera ingresos; es una mujer luchadora y muy trabajadora. 

Solicita su primer crédito con el apoyo de Kiva para realizar mejora en su casa ya que nececita realizar una mejora en el local del negocio.  

Su sueño es que su negocio cresca cada vez mas y que a su hijo no le falte el pan de cada dia.
texts.en:
This young woman lives in Nueva Guinea. She is married and the mother of a 13 year-old son, who is in secondary school. Johana is a professional and works at Radio Manatial. She has worked for 18 years. She is a sales advisor, which is how she makes her income to raise her son. She also has a small stationary store, which also generates income. She is a determined and very hardworking woman.

She is requesting her first loan with the support of Kiva, in order to make some improvements to the part of her house where she has her business.

Her dream is for her business to grow and grow and for her son never to go hungry.

loans.use: To make improvements to the part of her house where her stationary store is located

loans.name: Isolda Adilia

texts.es:
Isolda es una pequeña comerciante, que inicio hace cuatros años vendiendo granos básicos y una variedad de productos en pocas cantidades, con el objetivo de obtener ingresos  propios para solventar los gastos, su esposo labora como electricista
Y que gracias a su tenacidad y apoyo de la institución logra  aumentar sus niveles de venta, al ofrecer más variedad en sus mercaderías con precios más competitivos. Comprando a proveedores para dar precios accesible.
Con este nuevo préstamo invertirá en mayor cantidad de granos básicos, golosinas, gaseosas, así como el aumento de cuadernos, lápices escolares. El cual está cada día, animada para seguir fortaleciendo su negocio.
texts.en:
Isolda is a small business owner. She started a business four years ago selling basic grains and a variety of products in small quantities, with the goal of helping with the family’s expenses. Her husband works as an electrician.

Due to her tenacity and the support of the institution [AFODENIC], she has been able to increase her sales by offering a greater variety of merchandise at competitive prices. She buys from suppliers so she can offer accessible prices.

With this new loan she will buy a larger quantity of basic grains, sweets, soft drinks, and also more notebooks and school pencils. She is cheerful everyday about strengthening her business.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, sweets, soft drinks, and school supplies

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Palabra De Mujer. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora María, tiene 26 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro  hijos de 9, 6, 3 y 2 meses,  los dos mayores  estudian en escuela. El marido es chofer de una volqueta.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  ventas es puerta a puerta y  también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local. Trabaja de lunes a viernes en las tardes, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada ocho días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite. Nos cuenta que lleva siete años que se dedica a esta actividad y lo que más vende es ropa de niños.

Este crédito es para comprar  pantalones, camisetas, blusas, ropa de niños, interiores, entre otras prendas.  Lleva cinco ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos sin tantos requisitos. Sus sueños son comprar un carro para llevar sus productos a vender a otros lugares.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the 'Palabra de Mujer' (Woman's Word) community bank meets in the town of Charapoto.  This town is known for its traditional culture and for the fact that it is located just a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province: San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Here we meet María.  María is 26 years old and lives with her partner with whom she has four children aged 9, 6, 3 and 2 months.  Her two eldest attend elementary school.  Her husband is a dump truck driver.

María's business is selling all kinds of clothes.  She makes her sales door to door and also sells from her home where she has a small premises.  She works every afternoon from Monday to Friday.  She leaves her goods with her customers on credit and returns to collect payment every week.  María buys her merchandise in Guayaquil every two weeks or every month depending on what she needs.  She tells us that she has been in this business for seven years and what she sells most of is children's clothes.

María will use this loan to buy pants, t-shirts, blouses, children's clothes, underwear and other garments.  She has been a member of her community bank for five loan cycles and she likes it because the loans are dispatched quickly and don't have so many requirements.  Her dream is to buy a car so that she can take her products to sell in other places.

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, children's clothes, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Lidys Milena

texts.es:
Lidys, de 39 años de edad, nacida en la ciudad de Estelí, es casada, tiene 4 hijos a su cargo se dedica  la elaboración de tortillas y es dueña de un molino, solo aprobó la primaria pues, por la difícil situación económico que le toco vivir  no pudo seguir estudiando. 
Inicio esta actividad atraves de un grupo llamado  Movimiento María Elena Cuadra, que le brindo un crédito para comprar su molino.
