Lleva en este negocio 5 años , lo tiene ubicado dentro de su casa, anteriormente vendía productos cosméticos  y ropa  pero no era suficiente para poder mantener a sus hijos ,que actualmente están en secundaria así que mejor se dedico , a la actividad del molino y las tortillas ,apoyada por su marido quien trabaja como vendedor de repuestos de vehículos. 
Solicita el crédito para compra de maíz y leña, este crédito le ayudara  a comprar materia prima a mayor cantidad con un menor precio y poder tener abastecido  su inventario.
Dentro de sus planes tiene seguir vendiendo más tortilla, aumentar su clientela y tener  recursos para poder darles una carrera universitaria a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Lidys, age 39, was born in the city of Estelí.  She is married and has four children under her care.  She makes tortillas, and she owns a mill.  Due to the difficult economic situation in her life, she only has an elementary school education.  She could not continue her education.

She started this business activity through a group called Moviemiento María Elena Cuadra.  The group gave her a loan to buy her mill.  She has had this business, which is located in her house, for five years.  She previously sold cosmetic products and clothes.  However, that was not enough to be able to support her children, who are currently in high school.  It is better that she decided on the business activity of the mill and the tortillas.  Her husband helps her.  He works selling vehicle replacement parts.

She is requesting the loan to buy corn and firewood.  This loan will help her buy greater quantities of raw materials at a better price.  Also, she will be able to stock her inventory.

Her plans are to continue selling more tortillas, increase her clientele, and to have the resources to be able to give her children a college education.

loans.use: To buy corn and firewood

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario, es una mujer disciplinada y atenta, tiene 47 años. Es madre sola y vive en su casa propia en compañía de sus hijos. Rosario, es una emprendedora mujer de mil oficios, pero lo que más le gusta hacer es la costura, ya que en su casa cuenta con su maquina de coser, con ella puede remendar la prendas que sus clientes necesitan. De esta manera  viene trabajando por más de 20 años, actividad que le ha generado buenas utilidades. Hoy se siente contenta con lo que hace, ya que gracias a las ganancias que recibe, puede solventar los educativos de sus hijos, así como el de cubrir algunas necesidades dentro del hogar. Sabe que trabajando con mucho esfuerzo y empeño, más adelante logrará  hacer realidad su sueño de instalar una fuente de soda en su casa y de esa manera cubrir la educación superior de sus hijos. Es su segundo crédito que tiene con MFP, promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere defraudar a ustedes que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. De obtener el crédito que solicita, comprará cremalleras, hilos, telas y botones al por mayor.
texts.en: Rosario is a disciplined and attentive woman.  She is 47 years old and is a single mother.  She lives in a house that she owns with her children.  Rosario is an enterprising woman of many trades.  However, she likes sewing the most since she has a sewing machine in her house and can use it to mend the pieces of the clothing that her customers need.  She has been working in this business for more than 20 years and it has generated good profits.  She is happy with what she does because thanks to the income that she receives, she can cover her children’s educational expenses as well as some of the household needs.  She knows that if she works hard, she will be able to fulfill her dream of setting up a soda fountain in her house and this way, cover her children’s post-secondary studies.  This is her second loan with MFP and she promises to make her payments on time, as she does not want to disappoint all the people who made the loan possible that will allow her to continue working in search of progress.  Upon obtaining the loan requested, she will purchase zippers, thread, fabrics, and buttons at wholesale.

loans.use: To buy zippers, thread, fabrics, and buttons at wholesale

loans.name: Cruz Enrique

texts.es:
El joven C., de 26 años de edad, es originario de la Concordia una comarca localizada en la cuidad de Jinotega, es soltero, de oficio carpintero y agricultor, solo pudo llegar hasta primer año de la secundaria debido a que se había quedado si  trabajo y no tenia como seguir pagando sus estudios.
Inicio con su papa a la edad de 12 años, después se fue a trabajar a una empresa como carpintero donde la pagaban C$ 120 córdobas mas la alimentación, trabajo ahí durante un año  debido a que la empresa se traslado a otro lugar, dejo  ese trabajo y decidió independizarse por si solo y no continuo sus estudios, pues para poder acudir a su centro de estudio se tiene que caminar media hora todos los días.  Además tenia que ayudar a su padre llevar el alimento de todos los días, tiempo después se especializo en albañilería  mas su experiencia en agricultura ha podido sobrevivir y crear su propio negocio de siembra.
Solicita el préstamo para comprar 2 bueyes que le ayuden en el arado de la tierra para cultivos, pues así no tendrá que prestar bueyes a otras personas y tener lo suyo propio, asi  poder producir mejor y sembrar cebolla, frijol, repollo.
El espera que con este crédito pueda permitirle aumentar su negocio, comprar herramientas de trabajo como una moto cierra, para afinar su trabajos de carpintería y desea tener un taller donde pueda elaborar todo tipo de muebles elaborados por, darle trabajo a otras personas y sacar adelante sus cultivos.
texts.en:
C. is 26 years old and is a native of Concordia, a district located in the city of Jinotega. He is single and is a carpenter and farmer. He only completed up to his first year of secondary school because he didn’t have a job and couldn’t continue paying for his studies.

He began working with his father when he was 12 and later went on to work as a carpenter at a company where they paid him 120 Nicaraguan Córdobas (NIO) and provided him with food. He worked there for a year until the company relocated to another area, so he left that job and decided to become independent. He didn’t continue his studies because he would have to walk a half an hour every day to reach the school. In addition, he had to help his father provide food for the family every day. Later, he specialized in building and his experience in farming allowed him to create his own business.

He is requesting the loan to purchase two oxen to help him plow his farmland so that he will have his own oxen and will not have to borrow them from other people. This way, he can have better crops and grow onion, beans, and cabbage.

He hopes that with this loan, he will be able to expand his business and buy tools like a chain saw to sharpen his carpentry jobs. He wants to have a workshop where he can make all types of furniture by giving work to other people and having his crops progress.

loans.use: To buy two oxen to help him plow his farmland

loans.name: Mujeres Del Sol Group

texts.es: La Sra. Amelia  es conviviente, tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar  y  tiene 27 años D. edad,  actualmente es socia  en la alcancía comunal “Mujeres del Sol” grupo  conformado por 14  socios que se dedican a diversas actividades D. comercio. Amelia trabaja en una bodega donD. venD. abarrotes, dulces, gaseosas, y lo inauguró hace 10 días, este trabajo surge a raíz D. que su primer hijo entra al colegio por primera vez  y es así su deseo D. brindarle lo mejor  a sus hijos  y su deseo D. superación D. Amelia no tiene limites, Su sueño D. Amelia es tener una bodega más granD. y  vender al por mayor pero lo mas importante es ver a sus dos hijos profesionales,  este es el primer préstamo que Edaprospo le otorga, y gracias a ello puso su negocio. Sabemos que Amelia cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos D. Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en: Amelia is 27 years old, has a live-in partner, and has two school-aged children.  She is currently a member of the Mujeres del Sol Communal Bank, which consists of 14 people who work in different areas of business.  Amelia works at a grocery store that she opened 10 days ago where she sells groceries, candy, and soda.  She began this work because her first son is starting high school and she wants to proviD. her children with the best.  Amelia has an unending desire to get ahead in life and her dream is to have a larger grocery store and sell at wholesale.  However, her most important dream is to see her two children be professionals.  This is the first loan that EDAPROSPO is granting to her and thanks to this loan, she started her business.  We know that Amelia will meet her goals with a lot of work and effort, and that the loans from EDAPROSPO will help her.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Fanny Sonia Margarita

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Palabra De Mujer. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

La señora Fanny es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos a podido financiar un poco su negocio. Tiene 46 años de edad, en la actualidad está soltera pero de una relación que tuvo hace varios años tiene dos  hijos de 19 y 15 de edad que aun viven con ella y estudian en colegio y Universidad.

Se dedica al comercio en lo que es venta de gas de uso domestico, nos cuenta que es la primera que empezó con este negocio en Charapoto  hace 16 años y que por esto tiene la franquicia del ministerio, ella entrega el gas al por mayor a comerciantes de la zona y también vende por unidades. También vende productos naturales de la marca Winalite. Trabaja todos los días desde las 7h00  hasta las 20h00 esto lo hace con la ayuda de sus hijos.

Este crédito es para comprar más gas de uso domestico.  Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
The Palabra de Mujer Communal Bank meets every 15 days in the city of Charapoto, which is known for its traditional culture and for being a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province – San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Fanny is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it because she has been able to fund her business a bit with the loans. She is 46 years old and is currently single, but she had two children from a former relationship that are 19 and 15 years old and still live with her and are students in college and high school, respectively.

She works selling gasoline for domestic use. She tells us that she is the first to begin with this business in Charapoto in the past 16 years and as a result, she has the authorization of the ministry. She delivers the gas at wholesale to the area merchants and also sells by unit. In addition, she sells natural products from Winalite. She works every day from 7am to 8pm and her children help her.

This loan is to purchase more gasoline for domestic use. Her dream is to keep moving forward with her business.

loans.use: To buy tanks of gasoline for domestic use

loans.name: Cinthia Monica

texts.es:
Cinthia Monica R. es una muchacha que estudio en la universidad para licenciatura en la Industria, en la universidad pública de Cochabamba, ella tiene 29 años, y tiene una hija de 1 año, el padre de su hija no vive con Cinthya, ella vive en la localidad de Quillacollo, en una zona rural donde está al pendiente del cuidado de su Hija y de su abuelita.

Cinthia Monica con mucho esfuerzo termino sus estudios pero aún le falta tramitar su diploma, por esa razón es que aún no trabaja ejerciendo su profesión, ella siempre trabajo con la producción lechera, gracias a esta producción es que pudo pagar sus estudios, ahora esperara un poco más para poder dejar a su hijita al cuidado de su abuelita y poder ejercer su profesión, mientras tanto ella tiene actividades múltiples aparte del cuidado del ganado vacuno, ella comercializa productos para la salud,  cremas y otros, además hace trabajos de investigación por computadora, para estudiantes de colegios y universidades, con estos ingresos extras se sustenta para poder dar una mejor calidad de vida a ella su abuelita y su hija.

Cinthia Monica solicita el crédito para la compra de forraje pada el ganado lechero, ella debe aprovechar esta época porque hay en cantidad y a precio económico. Posteriormente cuando su hijita sea un poco mas independiente tengas sus tres años  la podrá dejar al cuidado de su abuelita y ella podrá encontrar un trabajo que le genere mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Cinthia Monica R. is a girl who studied for her degree at the public university in Cochabamba.  She is 29 years old, and she has a one year old daughter.  Her daughter’s father does not live with Cinthia.  She lives in Quillacollo, a rural area where she is looking out for the care of her daughter and her grandmother.

With great effort, Cinthis Monica finished her studies.  However, she still needs her diploma to be processed.  That is the reason that she is not yet working in her profession.  

She always worked with milk production.  Thanks to this production, she was able to pay for her studies.  Now she will wait a little longer to be able to leave her daughter under her grandmother’s care, and she will be able to practice her profession.  

Meanwhile, she has multiple business activities besides taking care of the cattle.  She sells health products, creams, and other products.  Also, she does investigative work on the computer for high school and university students.  With this extra income she supports herself in order to be able to give a better quality of life to herself, her grandmother, and her daughter.

Cinthia Monica is requesting the loan to buy fodder for the livestock.  She needs to take advantage of the fact that at this time  there is a lot and it is at an economical price.  Later, when her daughter is three years old and a little more independent, she will be able to leave her under her grandmother’s care.  She will be able to find work that generates better income.

loans.use: To buy fodder for the livestock

loans.name: Norma Gladys

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Palabra De Mujer. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Norma, tiene 50 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene seis hijos todos mayores de edad, dos de ellos viven con ella. El marido es agricultor.
 
Es una gran ama de casa que también se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  ventas es puerta a puerta. Trabaja de lunes a viernes en las mañanas ya que a esta hora hace menos calor nos cuenta, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada ocho días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil una vez  al mes. Nos cuenta que lleva dos años que se dedica a esta actividad.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisetas, blusas, ropa de niños, interiores, entre otras prendas.  Lleva dos años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con el primer crédito le permitió poner su negocio para poder ganarse la vida. Sus sueños son seguir en su negocio y que este crezca cada dia mas.
texts.en:
The Community Bank 'Palabra De Mujer' meets every fortnight in the town of Charapoto. Charapoto is known for its traditional culture and also for being only a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the area: San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Here we meet Norma who is 50 years old and has a common law partner with whom she has six children, all of whom have grown up and two of whom live with her. Her husband is a farmer.

Norma is a housewife who also sells all types of clothing door to door. She works Monday to Friday in the mornings as she tells us that this is when it is cooler. She gives her customers credit and then collects the payments once a week. She buys her merchandise once a month in the city of Guayaquil. She tells us that she has been doing this job for two years.

This loan is to buy trousers, shirts, blouses, children's clothing, underwear and other things. She has been a member of the Community Bank for two years and she likes it because with her first loan she was able to set up her business and earn a living. Her dreams are for a stable business and one which grows with each passing day.

loans.use: To buy blouses, shirts, trousers, underwear, children's clothing, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of corn, maseca cornmeal, beans, wood and pork to make nacatamales (Nicaraguan tamales) and increase tortilla sales

loans.name: María Pascuala

texts.es:
María tiene 45 años D. edad, es viuda y resiD. junto a sus tres hijos en el sector Santa Cecilia ubicado en el distrito D. Chepén, una zona agrícola situada en departamento D. La Libertad, ubicado a una más D. una hora y media D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica desD. hace más D. tres años al diseño y  confección D. prendas D. vestir. Ella confecciona estas prendas para luego vendérselas a sus vecinos según los pedidos que estos soliciten por temporadas, este negocio es una fuente importante D. ingreso a la economía D. su familia.

María desea adquirir material como telas, accesorios, y otros que le permitan diseñar nuevos modelos con lo cual aumentará su producción y por enD. su negocio. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a la Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1200 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
María is 45 years old, widowed, and lives together with her three children in Santa Cecilia neighborhood, in Chepén district, an agricultural area of La Libertad department which is located more than one and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo.

María has been designing and making clothes for more than three years.  She makes her clothes and then sells them to her neighbors according to the orders that they make each season.  This business is an important source of income for her family.

María would like to acquire material such as fabric, accessories, etc. that will allow her to design new models, increase her production and, consequently, increase her business.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 1,200 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy materials, supplies and accessories for her business

loans.name: Nely

texts.es:
la señora Nely García tiene 59 años de edad, esta casada y vive en la aldea Agua Fria de la ciudad de Nacaome.
doña Nely se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion, su negocio es muy popular en ese sector.
Nely es una mujer que esta en las cosas de Dios por lo que sus vecinos, amigos y familiares tienen muy buena reputacion de ella.
el credito lo utilizara para invertirlos en su negocio, comprar mercaderia al por mayor.
Nely tambien hace trabajos de costura en sus tiempos libres.
 
su mayor anhelo es terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Nely García is 59 years old, married, and lives in the village of Agua Fria, near the city of Nacaome.  Nely's business is selling essential food products and she has a grocery store in her home.  Her business is very popular in the area.  Nely is a religious woman and, for this reason, her neighbors, friends and family members say that she has a very good reputation.

Nely will use her loan to invest in her business, buying merchandise wholesale.  She also does sewing jobs in her spare time.

Nely's biggest wish is to finish building her home.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, coffee, bread, soft drinks, churros, butter, oil, beans, corn flour and wheat flour, eggs, soups, soap, toilet paper, candies, candles, juice, matches and batteries

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, es una mujer muy cautelosa, de 76 años. Es separada vive sola, ya que sus 5 hijos viven fuera de su casa con sus familias. Cuando aún sus hijos eran pequeños, ella y su ex esposo trabajaban en diversos negocios resultándole muy rentables, y cuyas ganancias que recibía pudo brindar bienestar de sus hijos, y construyeron su casa de a poco. En la actualidad ha dejado de realizar aquellos negocios;  por su avanzada edad, sin embargo ha persistido para terminar de construir su casa.  Desde entonces hace 20 años que alquila sus habitaciones y departamentos independientes, y por ello esta siempre empeñosa de terminar con los acabados de su casa, ya que eso asegura poder alquilarlos a un buen precio. Ahora tiene planeado construir otra habitación más. Es su 16avo crédito que tiene con MFP, y dice “que confíen en ella y estén seguros que pagará todas sus cuotas puntualmente como lo hacia ”, ya que le gustaría contar con posteriores ayudas. De obtener el crédito que solicita, comprará cemento, arena y pagar al albañil que construya las paredes de su cuarto.
texts.en:
María is a very cautious 76 year-old woman.  She is separated and lives alone since her 5 children live in their own homes with their families.  When her children were still young, María and her husband used to work in a number of businesses which were very profitable and they used the profits they made to provide for their children's well-being.  They also built their own home.

María no longer carries out her old businesses owing to her age but she has persisted in finishing the building of her home.  For 20 years she has been renting out her rooms and independent apartments.  She is always working hard to finish off the work on her home since this allows her to rent the rooms out at a good price.  María is now planning to build an additional room.

This is María's 16th loan with MFP and she says that people can trust her and be sure that she will make all her loan repayments on time as she has up until now as she would like to be able to rely on subsequent loans.  She will use the loan that she is requesting to buy cement and sand, and to pay the builder who will build the walls of her room.

loans.use: To buy cement and sand, and to hire a builder

loans.name: Ileana Matilde

texts.es:
Ileana  es una pequeña comerciante, con un negocio en su casa de habitación una pulpería que desde hace siete años comenzó  con pocos productos, y dinero que su esposo dio, de sus ahorro de trabajo como supervisor, el cual incremento con financiamientos que Afodenic,  otorgo. Vendiendo productos de consumo como. La venta de carne de res, de cerdo, pollo, productos lácteos.
Lo que mejoro sus condiciones de ingreso para dar lo necesario a sus dos hijos. 
Con este nuevo préstamo, invertirá en granos básicos, golosinas, cereales, productos enlatados, carne de res, carne de cerdo, pollo, huevos, entre otros de mayor de consumo, que le genere mayor rotación de venta.
texts.en:
Ileana is a shopkeeper who runs a small grocery store out of her home. She opened the store seven years ago with a limited number of products. She was able to do this thanks to money that she received from her husband, who works as a supervisor, combined with funding that she received from AFODENIC. She sells basic products such as beef, pork, chicken and dairy products. These sales have helped her to fulfill her children's basic needs.

Ileana plans to use this new loan to purchase dry grains, candy, grains, canned goods, beef, pork, chicken and eggs, among other staple goods which will help her to increase sales.

loans.use: She will purchase dry grains, candy, grains and dairy products, among other items in order to increase sales.

loans.name: Luis Manuel

texts.es: Luis Manuel se dedica a una pulpería. Hace más de 4 años, que tiene este medio de vida. Por lo que no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos y se encuentra muy contento con este medio de vida. Inicio porque Luis no tenía un trabajo estable que le generara ingresos diarios, por lo que siempre se ha preocupado por mantener a su familia. El solicita este crédito para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan, galletas y granos básicos. Sueña con mejorar sus ingresos cada día más y agrandar su inventario.
texts.en:
Luis Manuel owns a grocery store and has been in this business for more than 4 years.  This is not the first time that he has taken loans and he is very happy with his work.  Luis started his business because he didn't have a stable job that made him daily income.  He has always looked after and supported his family.  

Luís is requesting this loan to buy candy, soft drinks, bread, cookies and basic grains.  He dreams of improving his income every day and increasing his stock.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es:
Alfonso es padre de familia muy responsable para el bienestar de sus tres pequeños hijos, hoy en día tiene su propio estudio fotográfico el cual ha ido mejorando su tecnología para la venta, ya que la demanda es mucha. Y que ha logrado estas mejoras gracias al financiamiento que Afodenic dio, por medio de préstamo a plazos en donde logra pagar en tiempo y forma para un futuro mejor.
Con este nuevo financiamiento, comprara lente canon, que tiene dañado y que es de gran relevancia para ejecutar su trabajo.
texts.en:
Alfonso is a very responsible father. He looks out for the well-being of his three young children. Alfonso has his own photography studio. He has been upgrading his equipment as demand for his work is high. 

He has been able to make these improvements and work toward a brighter future thanks to the funding he received from AFODENIC. He received the loan in installments and was able to meet the loan conditions and pay it back on time. Alfonso plans to use the new loan to buy a Canon zoom-lens as his is broken and the lens is a crucial piece of equipment for his work.

loans.use: Purchase of a camera zoom-lens to help him continue with his work.

loans.name: José Adrian

texts.es:
José es un padre de familia de 53 años de edad, que reside junto a su familia en el caserío La Pilca ubicado en el distrito de Olmos. Un distrito agrícola conocido como la capital del Limón que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo

José se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura. Él cría desde hace 8 años ganado ovino y caprino, especialmente ovejas, en un corral situado cerca a su domicilio. El los alimenta de granos y pastos naturales, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentemente visitan la zona en donde reside. 

José desea adquirir más animales y alimento balanceado para ampliar su negocio y percibir mayores ingresos. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

José es una persona bastante empeñosa y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
José is father to a family and is 53-years-old. He lives with his family in the village La Pilca located in the Olmos district. It is an agricultural district known as the Lemon Capital and is in the Lambayeque province, more than an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

José works in agriculture. He has raised sheep and goats, especially ewes, in a pen near his home for 8 years. He feeds them natural grains and grasses and when they have grown to a good size he offers them for sale to the dealers who regularly visit the area in which he lives.

José would like to buy more animals and balanced feedstock to grow his business and to receive a higher income. For this reason he saw fit to request a loan of 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to help him achieve his objective.

José is a suitably earnest and hard working man, his biggest wish is to continue growing as an entrepreneur so as to be able to provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: To buy livestock and balanced feedstock

loans.name: Aura Monserrate

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Palabra De Mujer. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar encontramos a al señora Aura, tiene 26 años de edad y en la actualidad está separada pero de esa relación tiene dos hijos de 9 y 3 años de edad, el mayor esta en escuela. Ella vive con sus hijos en casa de sus padres.

Ella en sociedad con su padre tiene un taller de mecánica automotriz, mientras ella se encarga de lo que es trabajo de administración y venta de lubricantes, aceites y repuestos su papa se encarga del arreglos que  los carros de sus  clientes, trabajan todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00, nos cuenta que su papa lleva con su taller cerca de 15 años pero que ella lleva con la sociedad  tres años.

Este crédito es para comprar unas herramientas que se requieren para brindar un mejor servicio y también aceites y repuestos para la venta. Este es el segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que brindan para tener sus propios  negocios. Sus sueños son seguir sus estudios y así poder darles algo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Palabra de Mujer Communal Bank meets every 15 days in the city of Charapoto, which is known for its traditional culture and for being a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province – San Jacinto and San Clemente.

This is where we find Aura, who is 26 years old and is currently separated. She has two children from a previous relationship who are 9 and 3 years old. The oldest is in school. She lives with her children at her parents’ house.

She has an auto repair shop in cooperation with her father. While she is responsible for administration and selling the lubricants, oils, and spare parts, her father takes care of the customer care repairs. They work every day from 8am to 6pm. She tells us that her father has had his auto repair shop for almost 15 years, but she has been with it for three years.

This loan is to purchase tools that they need to provide better service, as well as for oils and spare parts to sell. This is her second loan cycle with the communal bank and she likes it because of the help that they provide so that the members can have their own businesses. Her dreams are to continue with her studies and this way, be able to provide her children with a better life.

loans.use: To buy tools, oils and spare auto parts

loans.name: Leydi Marilu

texts.es:
la joven Leydi Marilu L. C. tiene 29 años de edad, esta soltera y vive en la eldea de Agua Fria de la ciudad de Nacaome.

la joven Leydy tiene su negocio propio en el que vende varios productos de uso personal, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion y tiene ya hace varios meses de haberlo iniciado, a demostrado ser una mujer
emprendedora y muy servicial, tiene buena reputacion dentro de su comunidad ya que tambien es una mujer dedicada a las cosas de Dios y a las actividades de su comunidad.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mercaderia para surtir su negocio.
 
la joven Leydi tiene el anhelo de mejorar su vivienda y colocar su negocio en un sitio donde sea de mayor afluencia de personas, pero esto sera para un futuro depediendo como vaya evolucionando su negocio.
texts.en:
Leydi Marilu L. C. is 29 years old.  She is single and lives in Agua Fría village, near the city of Nacaome.

Leydi owns her own business where she sells personal care products.  Her business is located in her home and she started it several months ago.  She has shown herself to be an enterprising and very helpful woman.  She has a good reputation in her community since she is also a religious woman who takes part in activities within the community.

Leydi will use her loan to buy merchandise to stock her business.  Her wish is to improve her home and locate her business in a busier place.  However, this is a plan for the future and will depend on how her business evolves.

loans.use: To buy hair gel, deodorants, ointments, sanitary towels, toothpaste, candles, toothbrushes, Band-Aids, diapers and hair dyes

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
Tomasa es socia del  Banco Comunal “María Asunción Galindo”, ubicado en el distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito – Juli, departamento de Puno, tiene 55 años de edad, está casada y tiene 9 hijos.  Tomasa no cuenta con estudios.
Hace poco que empezó a trabajar con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, ella se dedica a  la crianza de trucha (pes), ella requiere de un préstamo de S/ 500.00 nuevo soles,  dinero que le permitirá comprar productos alimenticios para la alimentación de la trucha.
 Su sueño es comprar un terreno en Ilave y tener un puesto fijo para realizar la venta de trucha en mayores cantidades.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es el ahorro.
  En la foto la vemos hilando, es un actividad común en las mujeres de Puno, pero no es su actividad principal.
texts.en:
Tomasa is a member of the “María Asunción Galindo” communal bank which is located in Juli district, Chucuito-Juli province, Puno department.  She is 55 years old, married and has 9 children.  She did not go to school.

She started collaborating with Manuela Ramos Movement a short time ago.  She raises trout (fish) and needs a 500 new sol loan to buy feed for them.

Her dream is to buy a piece of property in Ilave and have a fixed stand to sell trout in larger amounts.

What she likes about the communal bank is the savings.

In the photo she appears spinning yarn, a common activity of Puno women, but that’s not her main activity.

loans.use: To buy trout feed.

loans.name: Mary

texts.es: Mary tiene 49 años,  es una mujer noble y muy pasiva. Vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo Wilmer, de 54 años y sus 3 hijos mayores e independientes. Desde hace 10 años, esta trabajadora mujer se dedica a la venta de productos perecibles, así como también su esposo se encarga del trabajo de tapicería, negocio que lo realiza en otro ambiente de su casa. En su bodega vende generalmente gaseosas, galletas entre productos envasados, siendo así el negocio preferido por los jóvenes deportistas de su barrio ó los que acuden a la tapicería de su esposo. Es por ello, que Mary trabaja en conjunto con su pareja, ya que también  le apoya en la atención hacía el público. Trabajando de esta manera, juntos han logrado educar a sus hijos que ahora son independientes y construyen su casa. Por eso, se ha propuesto en adelante incrementar y ampliar mucho más su negocio. Es su 16avo crédito que tiene con MFP, y se compromete pagar todas sus cuotas tiempo y, de ese modo con su compañera de grupo, continúen trabajando y accediendo otras ayudas que le permitan progresar. De obtener el crédito que solicita, comprará productos lácteos, gaseosas, cervezas. Asimismo, comprará cueros, tachuelas y esponjas para la tapicería de su esposo.
texts.en:
Mary, 49, is a noble, very passive woman.  She lives in her own house with her husband, Wilmer, 54, and their three adult, independent children.  For the last ten years this hard working woman has been selling groceries; her husband is an upholsterer, a business he carries out in another part of the house.  

In her store she sells primarily soft drinks, cookies, and packaged goods.  Her store is preferred by young athletes in her neighborhood and by customers coming to her husband’s upholstery shop.  Mary thus works in close cooperation with her spouse since she also helps him tend to the public.  Working together this way they have managed to educate their children who are now independent and are building their house. Because of this she has proposed in future to increase and expand her business quite a bit.  

This is her 16th loan with MFP and she commits to pay all her installments on time so that together with her fellow group members they will continue working and accessing future loans that will allow them to make progress.  If the requested loan were to be granted, she will buy such things like dairy products, soft drinks and beer.  In addition, she will buy leather, tacks and foam for her husband’s upholstery shop.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store as well as items to equip her husband's upholstery shop.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
la señora Reina Isabel C. tiene 53 años de edad, esta casada y vive en la aldea Puerto la Brea de la ciudad de Nacaome.
Reina tiene su negocio de costura, tiene varios años de dedicarse a este tipo de servicios el cual a sido  satisfactorio, porque de esta manera ha salido adelante con sus hijos e hijas.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materiales para la fabricacion de sus prendas de vestir y tambien para la compra de repuestos para su maquina de costurar.
la señora Reina es muy popular y reconocida en su comunidad ya que es una mujer luchadora y honesta.
la señora Reina tiene como anhelo terminar de construir su casa de habitacion.
tiene muchos clientes ya que este servicio de costura es escaso en esta comunidad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Reina Isabel C. is 53 years old, married, and she live in the community of Puerto la Brea in the city of Nacaome. 

Reina has a tailoring business. She has various years providing this type of service and it has been successful. She has been able to support her sons and daughters. 

The loan will be used to purchase materials to make items of clothing and to purchase spare parts for her sewing machine. 

Reina is very popular and well known in her community because she is a determined and honest woman. 

Reina's goal is to finish building her house. She has many clients because sewing services are uncommon in the community.

loans.use: To purchase materials and spare parts for sewing machines.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena is 32 years old, married, and has four children. She sells groceries from a small store in her parents' house. She will be using her loan of 600 PEN to purchase rice, sugar, and other supplies for her store. Business has been a bit slow during the rainy season, but she expects it to pick up once the school year begins in March. Elena is a member of the communal bank "Los Laureles," which is in its 38th loan cycle. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for three years and was invited by a friend. She enjoys that the loan officers teach her how to save and have informal guidance sessions during bank meetings.

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, and other supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchases livestock and feed.

loans.name: Nidia Lucia

texts.es:
Nidia es una pequeña comerciante, que se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos y productos de cosméticos con más de quince años en las ventas pues, ha tenido que esforzarse siendo madre soltera de tres hijos.
Sus ventas incrementaron con el apoyo de Afodenic, dando financiamientos en donde logro aumentar las ventas como la captación de clientes. Y ha venido durante estos cinco ciclos equilibrando su negocio, ya que atreves de sus ganancias, paga servicios básicos, alimentación, y sus compromisos de pago. Lo que está contenta por poder sobresalir cada día con su inversión.
Su préstamo será para la compra de cosmético, ropa, zapatos y otros encargos que demandan sus clientes.
texts.en:
Nidia is a small merchant selling clothes, shoes and cosmetics and has been in business for more than 15 years. She has had to work really hard as a single mother of three.
Her sales increased with the support of Afodenic’s financing; she was able to achieve increased sales and customers. During these five cycles she has been balancing her business and now can use her profits to pay for basic services, food and her payment obligations. She is happy to be able to excel every day with her investment. 
The loan will be used to buy cosmetics, clothes, shoes and other orders made by her customers.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, clothes and shoes to increase her sales.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es: Herminia tiene 46 años, es una piadosa y trabajadora mujer. Vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo Nelson de 39 años y sus 2 hijos aún menores. Después de haber vendido productos de belleza por muchos años, cambió de giro su negocio hace un año. Desde entonces vende prendas casuales para todas las edades a solicitud de sus clientes, y le va bien, por lo que tiene clientes conocidos de su anterior negocio.  Por lo tanto su negocio le resulta rentable; abasteciéndose cada fin de semana en el emporio comercial del centro de Lima, mientras la prendas como buzos y shorts se provee de una vecina que confecciona, ya que le deja a precios cómodos. Le gusta el negocio que realiza por lo que se entretiene mucho, por ello en adelante piensa incrementar su mercadería para vender al contado, y poder captar mayores utilidades, de ese modo poder educar a sus hijos. Ella pertenece a un pequeño grupo comunal, y este es su décimo crédito que tiene con MFP, demostrando compromiso y éxito con los integrantes de su asociación. Herminia, cada mes compra la mercadería necesaria de acuerdo el pedido que le hacen, por ello con el crédito que solicita, comprará pantalones, polos, shorts, para abastecer sus pedidos.
texts.en:
Herminia, 46, is a pious, hard working woman living in her own house with her husband, Nelson, 39, and their two minor children.

After having sold beauty products for several years she changed her occupation a year ago.  Since then she’s been selling casual clothes for all ages according to her customers’ requests.  She does well because she has customers still from her previous business.  Because of this the business is quite profitable.  She stocks up every weekend at a commercial merchandise mart in Lima and gets the sweatshirts and shorts from a neighbor who manufactures them and sells them to her at good prices.

She likes the business because she amuses herself quite a bit with it so she plans in the future to increase her stock in order to sell for cash and earn higher profits and be able to educate her children.

She is a member of a small communal bank and this is her 10th loan with MFP; she has shown success and commitment toward her fellow group members.  

Herminia buys necessary merchandise monthly according to orders placed with her so will use the requested loan to buy pants, polo shirts and shorts to fill those orders.

loans.use: To stock up on shorts, polo shirts and pants.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto tiene la edad de 47 años, padre de tres hijos, casado, con su propio negocio un taxi, en donde el mismo lo trabaja, el cual compro con su trabajo, como pintor.
Como objetivo ha sido la construcción de su casa con estos financiamientos que Afodenic ha dado, en donde ha mejorado con mejores condiciones su vivienda. Hoy con este nuevo préstamo hará la construcción de un muro para mejor seguridad de su propiedad y de su familia, ya que tiene el cerco con láminas de zinc, es por tal razón quiere hacer la mejora en donde comprara: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro, tablas de madera, clavos entre otros para comenzar a construir.
texts.en:
Roberto is 47 years old and the father of three children. He is married and he has his own taxi business. He drives the car himself and it was bought through his work as a painter.

His goal has been the construction of his house with these loans that Afodenic (Kiva Field Partner) has granted him. He has improved the conditions of his house. This new loan will be used to build a wall to improve the safety of his house and that of his family. He already has the zinc sheeting, so this is the reason why he wants to make the improvement, for which he will buy: gravel, sand, cement, steel, wood planks, and nails among other materials to start the construction project.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a wall.

loans.name: German

texts.en: German is 45 years old, married, and has four children. He is a member of the communal bank, "Los Laureles" at FINCA Peru in Ayacucho and was introduced to the bank by his wife. He has had a mototaxi business for three years now. Previously he had an office job for 15 years but left because he wanted to have his own business. He has been able to use his savings to purchase another mototaxi and wants to continue to increase his business and eventually buy a house. German will be using his loan of 750 PEN to purchase gasoline and parts and accessories to maintain his mototaxis.

loans.use: Maintenance of mototaxi and purchase of gasoline

loans.name: María Del Pilar

texts.es:
María tiene 39 años de edad, es divorciada y reside junto a su familia en el caserío CP 15 del distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comida. Desde hace tres años ella prepara alimentos en su domicilio y los ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y personas que vienen a trabajar en la zona, adicionalmente vende cerveza y chicha de jora. El negocio es de mucha ayuda para su familia, ya que por medio de este se encarga de ayudar al sostenimiento de su economía diaria.

María desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de insumos para elaborar más platos de comida ya que la demanda por su negocio ha aumentado, además desea comprar sillas y mesas para mejorar la ambientación de su negocio. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
María, 39, is divorced living with her family in Tambogrande district’s CP 15 settlement; an agricultural zone located in Piura province, Piura region, over four hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital.

She makes food to sell.  She’s been preparing dishes at home for the last three years that she sells to neighbors and people coming into the area to work; she also sells beer and chicha de jora (drink made from fermented purple corn).  The business is of much help for her family because through it she meets her daily economic needs.

María wants to expand the business buying ingredients to make more dishes because demand has increased.  She also wants to buy tables and chairs to improve the ambiance of her business.  Because of this she has deemed it convenient to request a 1200 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa to reach her objective.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and supplies to set up her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Paola Annabel

texts.es:
Paola García es de la isla trinitaria que hace algunos años antes ella se quedo sola su esposa la se fue de la casa y vio la necesidad de poner un negocio para sacar adelante a sus hijos.

Trabaja ella con la ayuda de sus padres y vende arroz azúcar y aceite. No tiene ningún inconveniente en su negocio y tiene 3 hijos 17, 15, 12 y estudian es escuela fiscal. Quiere su prestamo para comprar arroz, aceite, enlatados. Unas de sus metas es comprarse un carro
texts.en:
Paola García is from Isla Trinitaria.  A few years ago her husband left her and she was left alone.  She had to set up a business to support her children.

With help from her parents she works selling rice, sugar and oil.  She does not have any inconvenience in her business and she has three children who are 17, 15 and 12 years of age; they are all going to public school.

She wants her loan to buy rice, oil and canned goods.  One of her goals is to buy a car.

loans.use: For rice, oil and canned goods.

loans.name: Alianza Unida (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Alianza Unida está formado por 12 mujeres quienes viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es la tercera ciudad más importante del país. Su cultura, tradiciones y gran variedad en la gastronomía hacen de Cuenca una ciudad muy hermosa. Su gente es muy amable y cordial al igual que nuestras socias quienes laboran en diferentes actividades que les ha permitido ayudar en la economía de sus hogares.

La Señora. Paola Maribel Z. vive por el sector de Indurama en la ciudad de Cuenca, se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su mamá. Tiene 28 años de edad, es madre soltera de 2 niños  de 4 y 2 años, vive con su mamá y comparten los gastos del hogar, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
Doña Paola Maribel es de profesión estilista y labora en esta actividad desde que tenia 16 años, trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche.
El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de tintes, shampoo y otros productos de belleza para su negocio. Su meta es tener una sucursal de su negocio.

La Señora. María Auxilio N. tiene 57 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos quienes son mayores de edad y casados,  dos de ellos viven  independientes, su hija es quien vive en su casa y comparten los gastos del hogar. Su esposo labora en la construcción ya que es maestro albañil.
Doña María Auxilio se dedica a la cría de pollos, cuyes y cerdos a los que vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica, también trabaja en la agricultura y la cosecha es para el consumo de su hogar. 
En el banco comunal se encuentra en su sexto crédito y  lo va a invertir en la compra de más pollos. Su meta es  crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
The “Alianza Unida” (Unified Alliance) communal bank is composed of 12 women who live in different parts of the city of Cuenca.  This city is the country’s third most important.  Its culture, traditions and varied gastronomy make Cuenca a very beautiful city.  Its residents are kind and cordial just like our members who work in various activities that have made it possible for them to contribute to their households’ economy.

Mrs. Paola Maribel Z. lives around the Indurama sector of Cuenca.  This is her second loan with the communal bank.  Her mother invited her to join.  She is 28 years old and the single mother of two children who are 4 and 2 years of age.  She lives with her mother and they share household expenses.  She does not own her house; she rents. By profession, Paola Maribel is a hair stylist and has worked in this occupation since she was 16 years old.  She works Monday through Friday from 8am until 8pm.

Money from her loan will be used to buy hair coloring, shampoo and other beauty products for her business.  Her goal is to open a branch of her business.

Mrs. María Auxilio N., 57, is married and has three children who are adults and married.  Two of them live independently and her daughter lives with her and shares household expenses.  María's husband is a master bricklayer and works in construction. María Auxilio raises chickens, guinea pigs and pigs that she sells whenever she has economic need.  She also works in agriculture and what she grows is for home consumption.

This is her 6th loan in the communal bank and she plans to use it to buy more chickens.  Her goal is to grow in business.

loans.use: To buy hair coloring, shampoo, beauty products and chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover personal family expenses

loans.name: Rigoberto Armando

texts.en:
Rigoberto is single and lives in the highland region of Totonicapan, Guatemala. He has a university education and has no children. 

Rigoberto works as a loan officer at another institution and has been doing so for about six years (he started his career with ASDIR). He hopes to continue to develop his career as a loan officer and one day become the head of an agency. 

Rigoberto is requesting a loan to help pay for some recent personal expenses. This is Rigoberto's sixth loan through ASDIR, and the others have been paid back in full.

loans.use: To cover some recent personal expenses

loans.name: Pascual Heriberto

texts.es:
Pascual S. vive en Santa Elena "Playas" un primo de el lo condujo a trabajar en una zapatería, tenía 17 años. Luego de 10 años de trabajar como obrero se independizo.

Trabaja el y su esposa en la zapateria. Y tiene 2 obreros que le ayudan a la produccion de los zapatos,  empieza desde las 8:00am hasta las 6:00pm de lunes a sábado. Unos de sus obstáculos es que no cuenta con todas las herramientas ya que tiene que llevar los zapatos para que lo cosan. 

Los clientes no cumplen con sus pagos pactados y no poseer vehículo para transportar la mercadería. Está casado y su esposa ayuda al cliente se dedica a terminar los acabados de calzado. Tiene 2 hijos 13 y 3 años estudian en una escuela particular. Con el préstamo va a comprar hormas y insumos. Unos de sus sueños es tener un taller con todas las herramientas necesarias y que sus niños estudien
texts.en:
Pascual S. lives in Santa Elena “Playas.’ A cousin of his got him work in a shoe shop; he was 17 years old.  After 10 years of working as an employee he struck out on his own.

He and his wife work in the shoe shop.  He has two employees that help him make the shoes.  He starts at 8am and goes until 6pm, Monday through Saturday.  Obstacles he faces is not having all the tools he needs forcing him to take the shoes to be sewn elsewhere, customers who don’t pay as agreed and not having a vehicle to transport his merchandise.

He is married and his wife helps tend to customers and adds the finishing touches to the shoes.  He has two children who are 13 and 3 years of age; they go to private school.

He will use the loan to buy shoe trees and supplies.  One of his dreams is having a shop with all the necessary tools and another is that his children study.

loans.use: To buy shoe trees and supplies.

loans.name: Juana Edeytrudes

texts.es: Juana tiene 50 años, su actividad es una pulpería  funcionando en si vivienda en donde ofrece productos de primera necesidad como son los granos básicos, ella atiende personalmente su negocio y siempre ha contado con el apoyo familiar. Actualmente ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de arroz, azúcar, detergentes, café, aceite entre otros. Su deseo es mantener esta actividad económica ya que en estos tiempos es muy difícil porque hay mucha competencia.
texts.en: Juana is 50 years old.  She has a general store that she operates from her house where she offers everyday consumer products such as staple grains.  She attends to the store herself, and has always counted on the support of her family.  Now she requests this loan for working capital, which she will use to buy rice, sugar, detergents, coffee, cooking oil, and other items.  She hopes to keep this business going, which in these times is difficult because there is a lot of competition.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 46 años, es una bondadosa mujer. Es separada, vive en su casa propia en compañía de sus hijos Clara de 13 y Leonardo de 8 años respectivamente. Por más de18 años se dedica a tejer chompas que son exportados y hace 10 años vende productos nutricionales, que luego que cayera enferma estos productos la ayudaron en la mejora de su salud, desde entonces vende este producto, dando como testimonio su salud. Adicionalmente vende vinos, generándole así buenas utilidades. De esta manera, esta emprendedora madre de familia de a poco construyó una parte de su casa y mantiene sola a sus hijos, y está segura que  trabajando arduamente podrá  brindarles una buena educación que es su mayor anhelo. Pero, sí quiere dejar de tejer sus tejidos de chompas; por el desmesurado esfuerzo de sus ojos, y para compensar sus ingresos, en adelante piensa instalar una bodega en su casa ó alquilar un puesto en el mercado. Pertenece a un pequeño grupo y se entienden con sus compañeras. Este es su décimo crédito con MFP, y promete pagar todas sus cuotas como hasta ahora, por lo que quiere seguir contando con posteriores ayudas. De obtener éste crédito que solicita, incrementará más productos nutricionales para abastecer sus pedidos que tiene.
texts.en:
Rosa, 46 years old, is a kind woman.  She is separated, and lives in her own home with her children Clara, 13, and Leonardo, 8.  For more than 18 years she has knitted sweaters for export, and for the last 10 years she has sold nutritional products that helped her to improve her health after she got sick.  Since her recovery, she has sold these products, using her own health as testimony. Additionally, she sells wines, generating good income in this way.

In these ways, this entrepreneurial head of household slowly build part of her home and takes care of her children by herself.  She is sure that by working hard she will be able to give them a good education, which her her greatest wish.  But, she would like to stop knitting sweaters because her eyes are not as strong as they once were.  In order to make up the income, from now on she would like to install a small store in her home or rent a stall at the market.  

She belongs to a small group and she and her colleagues understand each other.  This is her 10th credit with MFP and she promises to make all of her payments as she has up until now, and she wants to continue accounting for past help.  On receipt of this loan, she will increase her stock of nutritional products in order to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: Increase nutritional products

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel, de 29 años es una mujer amable y cariñosa. Vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo Omar de 35 años y sus dos hijos. Maribel trabaja en un colegio particular, en el cargo de auxiliar del colegio cerca de su casa. Por lo tanto, es la encargada de la formación y la disciplina de los alumnos de ese colegio en épocas escolares. Le gusta su trabajo, a pesar de que los alumnos son inquietos y rebeldes, ama su labor, ya que con este ingreso ayuda a su esposo que es panadero, a cubrir los gastos de su hogar y la educación de sus hijos, además que poco a poco puede terminar de construir su casa. En adelante desea acondicionar un local e instalar su propia panadería, donde pueda trabajar su esposo y mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia. Este es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP, donde es una asidua  trabajadora mujer, por ello dice “que con confíen en ella y estén seguros que pagará todas sus cuotas puntualmente”. Por ello con el crédito que solicita, comprará cemento y arena, para mandar a construir las columnas de la pared de su casa, y con el resto pagará la mano de obra de su albañil.
texts.en:
Maribel, 29 years old, is a friendly and affectionate woman.  She lives in her own home in the company of her husband Omar, 35, and their two children.  Maribel works in a special school, under the charge of the assistant administrator of the school close to her home.  As such, she is in charge of the formation and discipline of the students during the school year.  She likes her work. In spite of the restless and rebellious students, she loves her job because with her income she can help her husband, a baker, to cover the costs of living and educating their children, in addition to finishing the construction of their house, little by little.   

In the future she would like to add a space for a store and have her own bakery, where her husband can work and improve the quality of life of the whole family.  This is her second loan with MFP, where she is a hardworking woman, for which reason they say "that the trust her and are sure that she make all of her payments punctually".  With the loan that she has requested, she will buy cement and sand, in order to construct columns on the wall of her house, and with the rest she will pay the mason for his labor.

loans.use: To buy cement and sand, and to hire a mason

loans.name: Celfida Del Carmen

texts.es: Celfida del Carmen se dedica a la venta de tiste y frijoles cocidos. Esta no es la primera vez que solicita créditos a Fundación pues siempre se ha caracterizado, por ser una mujer muy responsable y luchadora. Ella inicio este medio de vida porque su Mama enfermo, fue con el paso del tiempo que ella se ha hecho cargo de este medio de vida. Ella tiene una gran variedad de clientes que llegan a solicitarle sus productos. Este crédito que solicita es para la compra de leña, frijoles, tistes, bolsas, maíz entre otros productos.
texts.en: Celfida del Carmen sells cooked beans as well as tiste, a typical drink made with cacao beans.   This is not the first time that she has asked for a loan with the Foundation.  She has always proven herself to be very responsible and a fighter.  She began this way of life because her mother became ill, and as time passed she has taken charge of it.  She has a great variety of customers who come to ask her for her products.  This loan will be used to buy firewood, tistes, bags, and corn, among other things.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Pedro Francisco

texts.es:
Pedro  es un padre de familia de 51 años de edad, es casado y  reside junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos en el caserío El Porvenir Hualtaco ubicado a 15 minutos del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica  a la actividad de la agricultura, el siembra diferentes frutos. Pedro comercializa  frutales como limón, palta, naranjas, mangos cada uno en su época, Pedro extrae los frutos de arboles que tiene en sus terrenos de cultivo y los vende a acopiadores y a fabricas de limos.

Pedro desea adquirir fertilizantes para su cultivo lo cuales les permitirán obtener una buena cosecha es decir buena calidad de producto, de esta manera venderlos a un buen precio percibiendo márgenes de utilidades mayores. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a  Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de S/. 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Pedro is a head of household, 51 years old, married and living with his wife and their two children in the village of El Porvenir Hualtaco, located about 15 minutes from the agricultural district of Tambogrande, which is in the region of Piura, more than 4 hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the region of Lambayeque.  

He is a farmer and plants different fruits.  He sells fruits such as limes, avocados, oranges and mangoes, each in their season.  Pedro picks the fruit from the trees on his farmland and sells to the wholesalers and the lime factories.  

Pedro wants to buy fertilizers for his crops, which will let him get a good harvest and good quality products.  By doing this he will be able to sell them at a good price, getting a better profit margin.  For this reason he thought it a good idea to ask for a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 nuevo soles.

loans.use: Fertilizers for his fruit crop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Medical expenses

loans.use: Grow her vegetable-selling business

loans.use: For working capital.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson A. is from the village of Purok Pisces Suarez, Iligan City. He is 59 years old. Nelson is married and has six adult children. 

To make a living, Nelson owns and operates a business manufacturing and selling muriatic acid (a cleaning solution) products in several types of containers to local businesses and community members. Nelson has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nelson joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Nelson has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Nelson is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Nelson from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Bernandita

texts.en:
Bernandita B. is from the village of Lancangan, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 58 years old. Bernandita is married and has two adult children. 

To make a living, Bernandita owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling gasoline and motor oils in various containers in the local community. Bernandita has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Bernandita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Bernandita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital.

Bernandita is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like stocks of gasoline. This will be the third loan taken out by Bernandita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of gasoline

loans.name: Ester

To make a living, Ester owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling green and yellow bananas. She also sells fish like sardines and milk fish. Ester has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ester joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Ester has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Ester is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell like mackerel and salmon. This will be the third loan taken out by Ester from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

To make a living, Lolita runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods and beverages. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Lolita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, such as canned goods and beverages. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Lolita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. loans.name: Jorita

Jorita R. is from the village of Kibatang, Don Carlos, Bukidnon. She is 40 years old. Jorita is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Jorita owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling ready to wear clothing & shoe products from NATASHA & AVON in the local community. Jorita has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jorita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rebecca H. is from the village of Kapalaran, Dangcagan, Bukidnon. She is 46 years old. Rebecca is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Rebecca owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling spices, food seasonings, cooking oils, vegetables & eggs in the local community. Rebecca has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rebecca joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rebecca has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Rebecca is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, such as canned goods & spices. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Rebecca from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Mrs. PovS. was born in 1970, and she lives in Lvea Sa Kraom village in Kandal province. She earns her living by selling fruit in the market. She owns only a bicycle for transporting her fruit to the market. In order to support her business, she would like to ask for a loan to buy a motorcycle for transporting her fruit. She will add some of her own savings to the loan in order to purchase the motorcycle. 
 
Mrs. PovS. is a widow with three children: one works at a business washing cars, one is a laborer, and one is attending a local school.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Bo

texts.en:
Mrs. Bo S. was born in 1963, and she lives in Angk village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Moung Samay, are farmers who own a rice field, which is how they support their family. Mrs. Bo S. would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and gasoline to support their farming activities. In addition to growing rice, they also earn a living by breeding pigs.

This couple is working hard to support their three children: two are seamstresses in a garment factory, and one is attending a local school. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides, and gasoline

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Mrs. Touch V. was born in 1968, and she is a villager who lives in Angk village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she grows rice. Aside from farming, she also earns her living by selling recycled items. 

Her husband, Mr. Thorn Thy, was born in 1970. He is a fisherman and he also supports his wife's businesses. With their occupations, they are able to earn a small income to support their five children: who all attend the local school.

During this dry season she wants to grow more rice, but she doesn’t have enough money to grow it. Thus, she would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and gasoline to support her farming. She would use the rest of the loan to buy recycled items for selling. 

Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and gasoline to support her farming

loans.name: Kou

texts.en:
Mr. Kou D. is a villager in Pun Phnum village, Takeo province and he was born in 1968. He is a father of three children who are studying in local public school.

He is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where he can grow both rice and vegetables to sell to support his family. 

His wife, Mrs. Chhun Leng Ai, is a rice wine maker and a pig breeder. 

In the crop field, he has a problem because his field is infertile soil. So to improve production, Mr. Kou D. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer. With the rest of the loan he is going to buy pig food.  His wife is in the photo with him.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve his house.

loans.name: Sroeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sroeun S. is a married woman born in 1983. She is a villager who lives in Tuol Krang village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Vann Choeun, are farmers who own a plot of land that they use to grow rice and different vegetables for selling to help support their family. 

Aside from farming, Mrs. Sroeun S.’s husband also earns his living by fishing in the local village.
 
This couple has three children. Two are attending the local school and the youngest one is 5 years old and not in school yet.

They do not have enough money to support their farming. Thus, Mrs. Sroeun S. would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides and gasoline to support her farming crops. 

 Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides and gasoline to support her farming

loans.name: Kha's Group

texts.en:
This group loan has four members who are villagers in Trapeang Chamkar village, Takeo province. It is led by Mrs. Kha H.. The members will use their portions of the loan in varied ways to improve their family living. 

Mrs. Kha H. is a string maker. Her husband, Mr. Sokorn Kloeng, is a construction worker. She is the mother of four children. One is a construction worker,  one is a student, and the others are too small to study or work.

Since her business is getting on well, she wants to expand. For  this purpose, Mrs. Kha H. is applying for a loan to buy more materials to make string for selling. 

With the rest of the loan, she is going to buy some piglets for breeding to start a new business.

loans.use: To buy more materials to make string for selling

loans.name: Ym

texts.en:
Mrs. Ym H. was born in 1950, and she is a villager who lives in Ampil village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Tom Khann, are farmers who own a plot of land that they use to grow rice and different vegetables for selling to help support their family. This couple has a child who stays at home and helps the parents in farming. 

But they do not have enough money to grow their crops. Thus, Mrs. Ym H. would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides and to hire farm laborers to support her farming. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides and to hire farm laborers

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina B., from the village of Linabu, Balingasag, Misamis Orienta, is 47 years old, married, and has six grown children. To make a living, Angelina owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods and beverages in the local community. She also buys and sell dried fish. Angelina has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Angelina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital, she is requesting her seventh loan for 10000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods and snack foods. Angelina plans to use the extra revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods & snack foods

To make a living, Luisa owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling seafood products  including fish such as sardines & mackerel in the local community. Luisa has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Luisa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fish and as working capital. Luisa is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell such as salmon & sardines. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Luisa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
