loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” LOS ANGELES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sonia; la socia tiene 31 años de edad, casada y tiene 1 hijo; la socia produce flores ella les brinda el cuidado necesario para luego venderlo a sus clientes que se encuentran en el Valle Sagrado y en Cusco  especialmente en el mercado de Huancaro los días sabados de feria , a la vez la socia es docente del nivel primario ahora ella se encuentra de vacaciones y esta mas dedicada a cultivas sus flores, la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de semillas para la plantación de sus flores.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member who belongs to the Los Angeles communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Urubamba, belonging to the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco.

Her name is Sonia. She is 31 years old, married, and she has a son. She grows flowers and she brings them when needed to sell to her clients in Valle Sagrado and Cusco, especially to the Huancaro market on Saturdays. She is also a primary school teacher but she is now on holidays and she dedicates more time to grow her flowers. She is a very happy individuals and she eager to move forward.

She requests a loan to purchase seeds for her flower plantation. 

She is happy to receive this loan and she is committed to making the payments.

loans.use: To purchase seeds to grow flowers.

loans.name: Hilda

La socia pertenece al banco comunal” LOS ANGELES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Hilda; la socia tiene 29 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; la socia se dedica a la agricultura ella siembra verduras como zanahoria, lechuga, tomate entre otros, la socia a la vez compra y vende fruta y otras verduras que no produce, la socia lleva su mercadería a vender a las distintas ferias que se encuentran en el Valle Sagrado y en el mercado de Huancaro de Cusco, la socia es una persona bien emprendedora y 
con muchas ganas de salir adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de semillas para su chacra y para comprar otros productos para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member of the Los Angeles communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Urubamba, belonging to the Urubamba province and the department of Cusco.

Her name is Hilda. She is 29 years old, married common-law, and she has a son. She is an agriculturist who cultivates vegetables such as carrots, lettuce, and tomatoes among other products. She also busy and sells fruits and other vegetables that she does not produce. She takes her products to sell in the various fairs in Valle Sagrado and in the Huancaro market in Cusco. She is a very enterprising individual who is eager to get ahead. 

She requests a loan to purchase seeds to her plantation and to purchase other products for her business. 

She is happy to have this loan and she is committed to making the payments.

loans.use: To purchase seeds for her plantation and products for her business.

loans.name: Las Flores De San Antonio Group

texts.es: Lupe es una de las integrantes de la Alcancía Comunal “Las Flores de san Antonio”, denominada así por el lugar donde residen. A sus 50 años de edad Lupe es madre de 4 hijos de los cuales uno es un adolescente y está estudiando. Actualmente se encuentra separada de su pareja pero tiene el apoyo de sus hijos mayores.  Lupe tiene una bodega mediana en su vivienda, además vende productos de belleza por catalogo de compañías muy conocidas, está contenta pues le va bien en sus ventas y el préstamo le ha ayudado a mejorar las instalaciones  de su negocio. Lupe invertirá  el préstamo en la compra al por mayor de abarrotes como: arroz, azúcar y gaseosas. Ella es una mujer emprendedora pues tiene que asumir con responsabilidad los gastos mensuales de su casa y de su crédito para su propia mejoría y   de su familia. En la fotografía podemos apreciar a la señora Lupe luciendo un gorro blanco y una de las socias acompañada de su niña. El señor C. J. Cristian Jackson no pudo asistir al desembolso por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en: Lupe, 50, is a member of the Las Gardenias community bank. She has 4 children, one of whom is still in school.  She is separated from her partner, but she can count on support from her older children.  Lupe operates a corner store in her house.  She also sells beauty products from well-known companies.  She is happy with the business because sales are good.  Past loans have helped her establish the grocery business and she will use this loan to buy wholesale supplies of rice, sugar and soft drinks that she will then resell.  Lupe is an enterprising woman who has had to pick up responsibility for her family's expenses for the good of herself and the family.  Lupe is wearing a white blouse in the photograph.  The young girl is with her mother, another member of the group, and Sr. C. J. Cristian Jackson wasn't able to attend on the day the loan was distributed because he had to work.

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

The member belongs to the "LOS ANGELES” community bank. The bank is located in the district of Urubamba, which belongs to the province of Urubamba and department of Cuzco.

The member is Irma. She is 38 years old and in a common law marriage. She has 2 children. She works in agriculture, planting vegetables such as carrots, lettuce, and tomatoes, among others. She also buys and sells fruit and other vegetables that she doesn't produce.She takes her merchandise to sell at different fairs in the Valle Sagrado and in the Huancaro de Cusco market. She is a very enterprising person and really wants to get ahead with her family.  

She is asking for the loan to buy seeds for her plot of land and to buy pther products for her business. 

The member is happy with the loan and committed to making her payments.

loans.use: The member is asking for the loan to buy seeds for her plot of land and to buy other products for her business.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ANGELES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Alejandro; el tiene 38 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; el socio es agricultor lleva años en esta actividad el cual le brinda muchas satisfacciones tanto económicas y personales, sus cosechas lo lleva  a las distintas ferias que se realizan en el Valle Sagrado y los mercados de Cusco como el mercado de Huancaro, el socio trabaja conjuntamente con su pareja llevan años en esta actividad.  

El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de semillas para su chacra.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “LOS ANGELES” community bank. The bank is located in the district of Urubamba, which belongs to the province of Urubamba and departament of Cuzco.

The member is Alejandro. He is 38 years old and in a common law marriage. He has 2 children. He is a farmer and has been for years. This brings him a lot of economic and personal satisfaction. His harvests bring him to various fairs in the Valle Sagrado and to the markets of Cuzco, such as the market of Huancaro. He works together with his wife, and they have done this activity for years.  

The member is asking for the loan to buy seeds for his plot of land. 

He is happy with the loan and committed to making his payments on time.

loans.use: The member is asking for the loan to buy seeds for his plot of land.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El socio es el Sr. Mario; el tiene 29 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; el socio es agricultor lleva años en esta actividad el cual le brinda muchas satisfacciones tanto económicas y personales, sus cosechas lo lleva  a las distintas ferias que se realizan en el Valle Sagrado y los mercados de Cusco como el mercado de Huancaro, el socio trabaja conjuntamente con su pareja llevan años en esta actividad y de esta forma saca a su familia adelante.

El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de semillas para su chacra.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos
texts.en:
Mario is 29 years old, lives with his partner, and has one child.  He is a farmer and has been in this line of work for years.  His work brings him a lot of financial and personal satisfaction.  He sells his crops in markets in the Valle Sagrado (Sacred Valley) and also markets in Cusco such as Huancaro Market.  Mario works together with his partner.  They have been in this business for years and it is how they get their family ahead in life.

Mario is requesting this loan to buy seeds for his farm.  He is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy seeds for his farm

loans.name: Nanci Sulma

texts.es:

La socia es la Sra. Nancy Sulma ; la socia tiene 24 años de edad, casada y tiene 2 hijos; la socia se dedica a la agricultura ella siembra verduras como zanahoria, lechuga, tomate entre otros, la socia a la vez compra y vende fruta y otras verduras que no produce, la socia lleva su mercadería a vender a las distintas ferias que se encuentran en el Valle Sagrado y en el mercado de Huancaro de Cusco,a la vez la socia también compra otro tipo de verduras y frutas que no tiene para tener más variedad de productos que ofrecer a sus clientes ,la socia es una persona bien emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante por su familia .

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de semillas para su chacra y para comprar otros productos para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Nancy Sulma belongs to the Los Angeles Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Urubamba district, Urubamba province, Cusco department.  Nancy Sulma is 24 years old, married, and has two children.

Nancy devotes herself to farming.  She grows vegetables like carrots, lettuce, and tomatoes, among others.  At the same time she buys and sells fruit and other vegetable that she does not produce.  She takes her merchandise to sell at different fairs in the Valle Sagrado and to the Huancaro Market in Cusco.  She also buys other types of vegetables and fruits that she does not have in order to have a better variety of products to offer her customers.

She is a very enterprising person with a great desire to get ahead for her family’s sake.  She is requesting the loan to buy seeds for her farm and to buy other products for her business.  She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: To buy seeds for her farm and to buy other products for her business

Julia devotes herself to farming.  She grows vegetables to later distribute to her customers who request them. She also has a truck she uses to transport all of her harvests to be sold to her customers.

texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "LOS ANGELES", which is located in the district and province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.

Mrs. Maria Teresa is 48 years old, married and has two children.  She raises vegetable crops which she sells to customers on an order basis, distributing her goods at the fairs in Valle Sagrado and at the market in Huancaro in Cusco.  She also buys other types of vegetables and fruit in order to provide more variety to her customers.  She is very enterprising and driven to get ahead for her family.

She plans to use the loan to buy seeds for her land.  She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying shoes & weaves for selling.

loans.name: Braulio

texts.es:
El socio es el Sr. Braulio; el tiene 62 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 6 hijos; el socio se dedica a cultivar flores en su casa el tiene todo un huerto de flores el cual les brinda el cuidado respectivo para poder después venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, el vende al por mayor y menor hasta la ciudad de Quillabamba y Puerto Maldonado,el socio a la vez es maestro de obra el trabaja cada vez que le solicitan en las distintas obras que se realicen el socio es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de salir adelante por su familia.

El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de semillas para su huerto de flores.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos
texts.en:
Mr. Braulio is 62 years old and has a common-law wife and six children.  He grows flowers, which he tends too with great care, on land he owns near his home. He sells his flowers wholesale and retail in the cities of Quillabamba and Puerto Maldonado.  

He is also a civil works teacher who helps out when requested to by ongoing construction sites.  He is a very happy person, with a lot of drive to get ahead for his family.

He plans to use the loan to buy seeds for his flower field.  He is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy seeds for his flower field

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine

loans.name: Las Estrellitas De San Antonio Group

texts.es: Segundo es un joven emprendedor integrante D. la Alcancía Comunal “LAS ESTRELLITAS D. SAN ANTONIO” Se dedica conjuntamente con su conviviente a la venta D. productos D. plásticos como tinas, baldes y además artículos D. locería como platos, floreros. Como es necesario tener ingresos para mantener a sus 3 niños paralelamente trabaja como cocinero o mozo en diversos restaurantes, su sueño es llegar a ampliar su negocio y mejorar su vivienda, actualmente asume los gastos del hogar con su esposa. Este prestamos será invertido en la compra D. locería  en general y plásticos como: bidones, baldes y tinas. En la fotografía podemos apreciar a seis socios D. esta alcancía comunal y una D. las socias acompañada D. su niña. La señora Sánchez B. Martha Magda llegó tarD. al desembolso por motivos D. trabajo.
texts.en:
Segundo is an enterprising young man who is a member of the "Las Estrellitas D. San Antonio" (The Little Stars of San Antonio) community bank.  He and his common-law wife work selling plastic products such as tubs and buckets, and pottery items such as plates and vases.  As it is necessary to make income in order to support his three children, he also works as a cook or waiter in several restaurants.  His dream is to expand his business and improve his home.  He is currently responsible for his household expenses together with his partner.

Segundo will invest this loan in buying pottery items in general and plastic products such as cans, buckets and tubs.  In the photo we can see six members of the community bank and one of the members is accompanied by her daughter.  Mrs Martha Magda Sánchez B. arrived late to the disbursement of funds for work reasons.

loans.use: To buy pottery items in general and plastic products such as buckets, cans and tubs

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex is a 33-year-old married man with 6 children who lives in his own house in Hioma, Uganda. His goal is to educate his children in private schools. He has a business selling beans and distilling local brew.  He has been running this business for three years, raising his initial capital from farming. He is facing the challenge of transportation; in future he hopes to expand his business to other markets. Alex needs the loan to set up a store and increase his produce inventory.

loans.use: Loan will be used to purchase agricultural produce.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Operating capital to buy sacks, ice, sugar, fruits, straws, and other items

loans.name: Alejandro Antonio

texts.es: Alejandro 41 años, tiene 1 hijo a su cargo, por lo que tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación. Su actividad económica es el servicio de moto taxi, Don Alejandro inicio este negocio como chofer a un amigo, pero con el paso del tiempo Alejandro logro obtener unos ahorros y con un financiamiento pudo comprarse su propio moto taxi. Actualmente el ofrece sus servicios en su propio moto taxi, la mayoría de sus clientes no se quejan de Alejandro. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de repuestos y pintarla.  El sueña con mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Alejandro is 41 years old and has one dependent child.  He has worked a long time with Fundación Leon 2000.  His business involves providing motorcycle taxi services.  Don Alejandro started in this business by working as driver for a friend.  As time passed, he acquired some savings which he used, along with a loan, to buy his own motorcycle taxi.  He currently provides his service through the use of his own vehicle.  Most of his customers have no complaints.

The reason for this loan is to buy parts and paint his vehicle. Alejandro dreams of improving his home.

loans.use: Operating capital to buy spare parts & have his vehicle painted

loans.name: Camilo

texts.en:
Camilo is the father of two children. He operates a business selling fruits and vegetables. He will use this loan to increase his inventory of goods like pineapples, bananas, oranges, grapefruit, papaya and also some vegetables like potatoes, cassava, plantains and others.

Camilo is excited to be taking his ninth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid his previous loan and grown his business. He has had his business for 10 years, starting with his own savings. He will re-invest the profits in his business. His most difficult challenge is working for his children and he enjoys being in his house with them and his wife. 

His story is representative for others enterpreuners in his community and Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally.

loans.use: To buy fruits

loans.name: Julio Samuel

texts.es:
Julio Samuel  Agencia de A. tiene 49 años y  una familia conformada por su cónyuge y tres hijos en las edades de  diez, trece y quince años, con los que tiene firmes esperanza de apoyarles la consolidación de un futuro exitoso; él  tiene en el centro de la ciudad, una de las zonas mas comerciales de la ciudad de Barranquilla, un negocio donde ofrece los servicios de marquetería.  
Julio se inició trabajando con un comerciante de cuadros y en ese negocio fue  donde recopiló toda su experiencia  que le sirvió para conocer el oficio y el arte de la marquetería, por eso  antes de dos años  de trabajar allí, se independizó y emprendió su propia aventura de negocio con el que hasta hoy,  ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia.
 En la actualidad tiene cinco financiamientos con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con los cuales ha logrado financiar su cartera y responder a la demanda de sus clientes con mayor  variedad en los diseños, porque uno de sus sueños es   organizar una galería para ampliar su mercado y lograr una oferta bien exhibida, que impacte a sus clientes.  Con su primer credikiva, al que esta aplicando en la actualidad, comprará madera, clavos, puntillas, moldes y pegantes para hacer cuadros que tiene encargados, pues  cada inversión la hace sobre la base de su preventa lo que augura que esta sea exitosa .
texts.en:
Julio Samuel Agencia de A. is 49 years old and has a family that consists of his wife and three children (ages 10, 13, and 15). He has high hopes of supporting them and providing them with a successful future. In one of the most commercial areas in central Barranquilla, Julio has a business where he offers detailed inlay services.

He started his career by selling paintings. Through this business, he gained experience and knowledge in the art of detailed inlays. Julio has practiced this trade for two years, which allowed him to become independent and start the business he manages to this day. This business has helped his family move forward.

To date, Julio has received five loans from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. The loans were used to finance his portfolio so that he could respond to the demands of his customers by offering a wide variety of designs. One of his dreams is to organize a gallery where he can expand his market and effectively display his work so that his customers will be impacted. His first loan through Kiva will be used to buy wood, nails, tacks, molds, and adhesives for making artwork that has already been requested. Each investment he makes is based on the level of successful pre-sales he has completed.

loans.use: Purchase wood, nails, tacks, molds, and adhesives for his artwork

loans.name: Zobeida Judith

texts.es: Zobeida necesita comprar prendas de vestir  y calzado apropiado, porque tiene muchos clientes que lo han pedido para disfrutar de eventos   y bailar en la temporada de carnaval, fiestas de gran   derroche de talento y folclor caribe, entre disfraces, vestidos elegantes estrafalarios en un solo “disfrázate como quieras” y esto es justamente lo que haría con su credikiva,  comprar  camisetas, calzado, vestidos para niñas adecuados a esta fecha.   Zobeida inició su negocio vendiendo diversos productos mediante guías especializadas hace siete años,  inicialmente  cosméticos y accesorios , pero gradualmente cuando empezó a reunir un pequeño capital agregó ropa femenina, infantil y masculina, su primer mercado fue el de educadores y actualmente se ha expandido a otros cliente, entre amas de casa, estudiantes, trabajadores dependientes e independientes;   Zobeida cuando inició su negocio lo hizo para apoyar la gestión de su esposo en el hogar,  pues se dio cuenta que ambos debían ingresar dinero al hogar, para fomentar  en  sus tres hijos, que están en las edades de  3 a 20 años, un futuro exitoso mediante una educación de calidad.  Por eso no abandona su meta de organizar su negocio y darle un enfoque de almacén en un local  independiente, porque actualmente funciona en su propia vivienda  y esto repercute en el sosiego familiar, por eso desea independizar el espacio productivo del doméstico y ella trabajará fuertemente en ese propósito.
texts.en:
Zobeida has many customers who enjoy the events and dances during the Carnival season, so she needs to buy appropriate shoes and clothes she can sell. These celebrations overflow with great talent and Caribbean folklore, as manifested through the costumes, elegant gowns, and bizarre outfits in which people are invited to “disguise yourself however you want”. This is the precise reason for her Kiva loan. Zobeida will buy shirts, shoes, and girls’ dresses that are appropriate for this occasion. She started this business seven years ago by selling different products through specialized catalogs. At first she sold cosmetics and accessories, but as she accumulated a little bit of capital, she began offering clothes for women, children, and men. Her first customers were teachers and now she has expanded to other groups such as housewives, students, hired workers, and the self-employed.

When she started this business, Zobeida wanted to help her husband with managing their household. With two sources of household income, she is able to provide for her three children, who range in age from 3 to 20, and give them a quality education so that they will have a successful future. Zobeida has not abandoned her goal of organizing her business. Her focus is on opening a store in another location because she currently operates her business out of her home. By having a separate location, she will be able to maintain the family peace at home, so she is working hard to achieve this objective.

loans.use: Purchase shirts, shoes, and girls’ dresses for the Carnival season

loans.name: Jenis

texts.es:
Jenis O. Ramírez, tiene 33 años y vive en Barranquilla, ciudad donde comercializa mercancía variada, como bolsos, calzados, vestidos y productos de belleza; desde hace 18 años se inició en la actividad mercantil,  que fue su primera experiencia,  en el sector de alimentos,  vendía carnes frías  y con mucho esfuerzo, dedicación y disciplina, logro reunir gradualmente sus capital de trabajo, incluyendo en su oferta una gran variedad   de productos que  incrementaron sus utilidades, impactando positivamente  los ingresos de su hogar. 
Su meta principal es el crecimiento de su negocio, para seguir apoyando a su esposo en las obligaciones familiares que comparten, especialmente en lo que tiene que ver con la educación de sus dos  hijos. Su mayor desafío se presento cuando bajaron las ventas por la ola invernal que se presentó a finales del año pasado,  pero el negocio de Jenis  gradualmente se ha ido recuperando y ha vuelto a la normalidad.  Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y justamente su primer credikiva,  con el cual comprará vestuario y calzado, porque con esta venta ensanchará la cobertura de clientes, entre los que se encuentra   referidos  a los que quiere llegar y de los cuales tomó sus pedidos, esto  garantizaría la inversión exitosa de su credikiva.
texts.en:
Jenis O. Ramírez is 33 years old and lives in Barranquilla where she sells various items such as purses, shoes, dresses, and beauty products. She has been a merchant for 18 years, beginning in the food sector. She sold fried meats and with much effort, dedication, and discipline, gradually increased her working capital, and added a variety of products. This greatly increased her income for her household.

Her main goal is to enlarge her business, to continue helping her husband with their shared family obligations, especially their children's education. Her greatest challenge came when sales decreased with the cold weather at the end of last year. But the business has gradually recuperated and is now back to normal. 

This is Jenis’ first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and Kiva. She will use the money to buy clothing and footwear. With this purchase, she will widen her client base, from past customers to referred customers and future customers. This would guarantee a successful investment of the loan.

loans.use: Buy clothing and footwear

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es:
Wilmer Rodríguez definitivamente es un hombre muy feliz,  que siempre tiene proyectos en su mente,  su  anterior plan de inversión fue adecuar su puesto de trabajo con pintura y una publicidad que le ayude a identificar mas, la compra de materiales para la remodelación y elaboración de calzado pero adicionalmente se dio a la tarea de comprar calzado de marca y vender lo también, esto fue lo que justamente hizo con su anterior credikiva. En la actualidad está solicitando su segundo crédito por esta misma línea  porque va a comprar materias primas para elaborar calzados en consonancia con la temporada de carnaval que se avecina y comprará calzado para comercializarlos también porque le fue muy bien con que vendió en su anterior inversión. “Gracias por el apoyo brindado y la oportunidad de un nuevo crédito” este es un mensaje que Wilmer quiere hacer llegar a sus financiadores de Kiva mediante este medio.
Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Wilmer bien puede ingresar al siguiente enlace:
http://kiva.org/lend/170483
texts.en:
Wilmer Rodríguez is definitely a happy man who is always thinking up new projects.  His previous investment plan was to improve his sales stall with paint and advertising to help it stand out more, to purchase materials to repair and make shoes, and additionally he took on the task of purchasing brand name shoes to sell.  That is precisely what he did with his last credikiva loan.  Currently he is requesting a second loan through this same line because he is going to purchase raw materials for shoe making, in keeping with the approaching carnaval season.  And he will purchase shoes for re-sale as well because he did very well with those sales with his last investment.  "Thank you for the help you have offered and the opportunity for a new loan" is the the message that Wilmer wants to send to his Kiva financial backers.
If you would like to learn more about Wilmer's story, click on the following link:
http://kiva.org/lend/170483

loans.use: To purchase raw materials and supplies for shoe making.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es: Maria G. vive en la urbanización “Los Robles “ y desde allí se dedica a la elaboración de productos para decoración de fiestas, negocio que en  su condición de mujer  casada y madre de tres hijos en las edades de 6, 10 y 16 años,  le ha permitido responder a su obligación familiar mientras genera ingresos para el crecimiento y desarrollo de su familia; ella con su maquinaria elabora muchos productos , desde vestidos de fiestas como matrimonios, grados y quinceañeros, hasta adornos y detalles que impactan estos escenarios festivos, y llaman poderosamente la atención de los invitados a estos eventos.  Todo lo que Maria G. fabrica  depende de la solicitud de sus clientes y   están ligados generalmente a cada temporada, porque siempre está atenta a complacerlos, para que continúen comprándole y referenciándola a otros, así  ella  ensancha  su negocio y logrará en un futuro  llevar a sus hijos a alcanzar  sus objetivos educativos. Su sueño  es establecerse en el mercado para la cual está armando su carpeta promocional, porque  ella  planea  exhibir sus productos mediante una especie de catálogos  de ventas , que en futuro manejarán vendedores de sus productos, mientras ella produce. Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y el primer credikiva con el que comprará Bomboneras, chocolates, telas y accesorios de decoracion pues está contratada para eventos festivos que requieren una decoración acorde a la temporada carnavalera que se avecina..
texts.en:
Maria G. lives in the Los Robles housing development and there, she works making party decorations. Being a married woman and the mother of three children (6, 10, and 16 years old), this business has allowed her to respond to her family obligation while earning income for her family’s growth and development.

She makes many items with her machinery from wedding, graduation, and 15th birthday dresses to decorations and small gifts that have an impact on these celebrations and attract the attention of the event attendees. Everything that Maria G. makes depends upon her customers’ requests and it is generally tied to each season because she concerns herself with pleasing her customers so they continue buying from her and referring other people to her. This is how she expands her business and will have her children meet their educational goals in the future.

Her dream is to establish herself in the market and she is currently preparing her promotional folder because she plans to present her products in a sales catalog. In the future, she will have sales representatives while she makes the items.

This is her first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and Kiva and she will use it to purchase candy boxes, chocolates, fabrics, and decoration accessories, as she has been hired for celebrations that need decorations for the approaching carnival season.

loans.use: Candy boxes, chocolates, fabrics, and decoration accessories
